E51WpGsxS3w8mkYqh-Wsmg.text: I was invited to eat here, and I understand that everything in Vegas is expensive, but I felt this meal was a little ridiculous for what it was. The waiter was amazing and so funny and entertaining and just AMAZING, I have no other words for him! The food was decent, but I didn't think it was spectacular, I've definitely had better Italian food at a much more reasonable price.  If you go, I suggest you keep the food order simple and enjoy the wait staff, they are truly great.

LpPPGyiz3HJonwoffo6gtA.text: Once they finally took our order, they came back thirty minutes later saying they lost our order, and had to retake everyone's. Then finally just over an hour after that, food comes out partially incomplete and incorrect. We were a larger group, and they ended up giving us complimentary drinks and removing the charges for our appetizers, but still incredibly aggravating and won't be going back.

nqXqndKuIVEQGqfUqFvqCQ.text: Good food.  Terrible service.  And a manager who had no idea what she was doing.  Hey, how about getting to the table that is complaining within 5 minutes, not 20?  Why wasn't she on the floor.  Why did it take 3 people to find her?  The waiter sucked and didn't upsell a thing!  One drink for my husband and never asked him if he wanted another?  This is Vegas isn't it?

5RzN3iC9MNaNErR-ERsd_w.text: Ask for Jackie as your waitress and enjoy the best dining experience in Vegas. The food is fabulous. But Jackie made it a night to remember. If you're ever in San Francisco, Jackie.... just sayin  :-)

EYIWYSubbEM7LyMdmXAkuA.text: This place was just completely meh.  Came here with a group for a birthday dinner when I was in Vegas.  It seems like most people reviewing places in Vegas are pretty high-rollers, who don't balk at a $100/person price tag on a meal, but frankly if I'm paying that much I expect something good.  The food was bland and boring, as were the drinks.  I didn't even notice the service, so that suggests to me it was equally bland.  Take your business elsewhere-- it seems like these Vegas restaurants need to learn that people won't just keep coming back and paying prices like that for sub-par food.

LzACgqyxjW9gYBydevkJOw.text: Food: 4 star - I'm a fan. (See picture I uploaded)  Service: 3 star - a OK   My friend and I had a reservation in Canaletto for dinner. We requested to be sit somewhere inside that can still overlook "St. Mark's Square". When we arrived, there was a little line to the host but everyone was turned down and left. I was glad we made reservation because we were immediately brought to our table. The restaurant was crowded on a week night.   We ordered the Fettuccine with pork and mushroom, and the Frittura de pesce misto. The Waiter seemed like he was not happy when we did not order any wine. The dishes arrived on beautiful plates. The fettuccine was not on the online menu but it was the best I had. It did taste homemade because it was chewy. The sauce was very good which was not too heavy or light, just the right texture. Pork and mushroom were cooked in perfection. This was a great dish.   We should not have ordered the Fritture de pesce misto. The deep fry seafood was in large portion and too much to be shared between two people. There was only one or two scallop and too many calamari. I liked the fry smelts and this dish would probably be ideal if there were more people to share.   I would definitely come back for more paste when I visit Vegas another time.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccine with pork and mushroom, and Frittura de pesce misto (Fry Seafood)

p39fkYdKklnPdIjiyGyD3w.text: Came here to get some grub before going out. The waiter service was very friendly and the bread was delicious! Half of us ended up getting full just off of the bread. It's foresight, you know...carbs to help lighten the effects of alcohol. Urban myth? I hope not, I've been living by that for a while.   I ordered the sea bass filet, which our server had recommended. I was disappointed.  The sauce that they use was way too salty, and they must have unloaded of quart of that stuff all over my food. The menu mentioned potatoes. I got about six mini pieces. Seriously, they could have at least added enough to fill up the plate. The sea bass itself was disappointing too. I was expecting oily, melt in your mouth sea bass. Instead, it was dry and a little tough.   Plus for the service. Neg on the actual food.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. some sauvignon blanc to go with dinner

9UE8z46Au-haKVEDo0xF0g.text: Mixed review. The food was enjoyed by most of our wedding party but the service was not good from the moment we were seated. Well not all of us since only 13 chairs were placed for a party of 15. Ok we can over look that, honest mistake right. Well it was mistake after mistake. I don't know if our waiter was new but he was clearly overwhelmed. We only had 15 people and 1 infant.   We pre booked our reception in a private room with a custom menu. We went over the menu around 3 times, please explain why it was wrong. Ok we can overlook that, not really but whatever what can you do. He takes our orders and I swear it took forever for our first course. Then forever plus forever for the main course. He didn't come by to refill glasses or take additional drink orders but hey we can overlook that. Then we had our wedding cake for dessert but no waiter anywhere to be found to clear the table, cut cake, bring dessert plates, etc. So everyone is sitting around and my lil one is becoming antsy. My new hubby goes to find a waiter for help, any waiter will do at this point. So the new waiter brings plates and does not remove 1 freakin dish from the table. Now I'm getting upset and my hubby knows it. Then the waiter comes back and serves dessert lemon vodka thing, I can't remember the name, while the other waiter is cutting the cake. Of course the children get ice cream because they can't have vodka. Well a guest to our wedding doesn't drink and requested the ice cream. The waiter then tells her no because it's only for children. No more overlooking!! Another guest actually gets up and gets the manager at this point. From the moment the manager arrived things went much more smoothly. He was very helpful. Oh and that other guest got a specially made ice cream bowl from the manager that she enjoyed.   This place may be good if you are just coming in for dinner but for a reception, not so much. Oh and don't order the veal it was tough.

l8qdlTaJI3viyRtwfO7lNg.text: My husband and I were stayin at the Palazzo so on our first night we just wanted to explore Palazzo & Venetian.. After shopping and takin our gondola ride, we decided to eat here.  We were seated promptly and because my husband and I love to sit next to each other and are very private, they granted our request and sat us in a booth. The servers were attentive, timely and knowledgeable. Our bread and butter came as soon as we sat down- the various breads were soft, warm and had enough crisp on the first bite with the dough melting right in your mouth.. The butter was at room temperature which spread easily on the breads.. They had an olive oil concoction w/ different spices that made it great for dipping..  As Ive mentioned before, my husband and I are great fans of calamari so we ordered their Calamaretti Fritti for an appetizer-  perfectly breaded and deep-fried w/out having the oily aftertaste nor left the plate it came on oily.   I was craving pizza and wanted something small so I ordered their "personal" pizza- Quattro Stagioni which were cut into four slices with each slice containing ham, mushrooms, asparagus and artichokes.. "Personal" my butt, it was HUGE and it was DELICIOUS, especially since I am not a thin crust pizza kinda gal!! As the calamari wasnt oily, this too wasnt oily- pure deliciousness.  My husband ordered Branzino as Sale o Alla Griglia (seabass) and that came w/ veges and mashed potatoes. The bass was meaty and his veges & potatoes were fresh. K is critical when it comes to his steak and bass and he was extremely happy with his meal.  We saw other dishes being served to other patrons and they all looked appetizing. We were not disappointed at all and were glad that we had our first dinner in Vegas at this restaurant. I highly recommend, if youre ever at the Venetian, to come check this place out.   But then again, its just my opinion..

nVgocD3Z8PjCfXvX3nT04Q.text: We first ate at Canaletto in 2001, when we first moved here and since then I have raved about a three-mushroom ravioli we had for lunch. Alas, they've not had that entree since and I always thought it was the best pasta I'd ever had. I still do. We ate at Canaletto with some friends a couple of nights ago and it was, well, alright. There were four of us and with gratuity it was about $35 apiece, a bit high for pasta dishes and salads with one dessert; all of which were, well, good, but just a level or so above mediocre. Sitting outside and "[staring] at the fun faux-clouds" as Marcia M. noted is fine; actually nice, once or maybe twice. The noise, however, is borderline intolerable and most of all, the Venetian's mimes seem to be gone.   And what the devil is it with diners and computers. Yeah, Canaletto has wi-fi, or the Venetian does but I find it annoying to go to a restaurant like this and see folks typing away on computers. Who the h*** is that important that he or she needs to be connected 24/7. So, perhaps, all who do this will take this strong hint: Leave your d*** computers at home when you dine out; stop texting in movie theatres...or just eat a Burger King.  Perhaps living in Las Vegas with all its great restaurants has jaded me a bit, but I'd rather go to Buca...

qtshFlFxiXeajbEGWpNiZw.text: Great happy hour specials. It was nice to get $7 drinks instead of the usual $18 Vegas price tag. The food was just okay. Nothing special. Great place to hang out and relax. They appear to always have a lot going on in their courtyard

d_R0DlYMDEgiyOUSqfXPgw.text: Wasn't amused. For being in such a prime space along the Grand Canal, you'd think they had more to offer.  Or maybe I wasn't trying the right thing.  Had their Caprese, when asked about maybe having a side of chicken with it... was denied. Turns out they grill their tomatoes and mozzarella. Fine, by me - but it really didn't do much. She offered prosciutto instead and that was a failed suggestion, because it added nothing.  My dinner partner had their pasta special. Penne pasta with chicken, vegetables, tossed in a red sauce. Nothing spectacular to note.  Service was slow.  The thing about service in a restaurant is timing. The server works itself in your time, and it's not the other way around. I could have been on a gondola and down the canal in between the time I waited for the dessert menu (which we decided to skip because it took too long) and asking for the check.  Thanks for trying, but I'll be somewhere else on the Strip...

raKTZipQrHQDDRNRVmm6aQ.text: Great food and flavors.. Very nice place to eat when in Vegas  I had the risotto with beef and my wife had the chicken and we were very satisfied with the meals and the attentive service..!

6mtsl-T_qlGZ5hzuoxMG9g.text: This place was a bit of a disappointment. Sure, it's a nice little restaurant in St. Mark's Square at the Venetian, the ambiance in nice, but the experience was not so good.  Service was slow and spotty. When we were seated, the waitress told us she was sending out water. Said water didn't arrive until we had received our meals and drinks, and only after we asked our waitress about it again. When we were offered parmesan on our food, the man who asked just walked away and vanished. We had to flag down or waitress to get it, who was noticeably absent throughout the evening. She then proceeded to absent-mindedly drop a huge chunk of cheese on the table, only to leave it there throughout the meal.  Food was alright and came out very quickly, though it was almost too quickly, as if it had already been prepared before we ordered it.   After the whole experience, I would probably not come back. There are many other restaurants nearby to choose from (it is Vegas, after all).

JXv3Tv3WViu-6wZ76GHZOw.text: had a lunch on the Chrismas day...without reservation! the courteous receptionist showed us to a nice booth inside without any wait!  we had 'insalata canelitto' ($8.99) and 'quattro stagioni' ($15.00) the salad was gresh and the vinegrette dressing wasn't over powering. the thin- crust pizza had 4 sections of dufferent toppings - ham, mushrooms, artichokes and asparagus. so yummy.  the waiter was very friendly, too.  really enjoyed a relaxing lunch with good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread &amp; water
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza

yZTQEntYT3cUPLWA9QvlDw.text: I had the lemon sauced/flavored chicken breast dish.  While th lemon sauce was tasty, everything else was only okay.  The veggies and potatoes were there and did not help complement the dish at all.  I didn't like the olive oil and vinegarette in the middle because it made it very difficult to enjoy the bread.

kDtdsdopLO5fmE1cLNhwyw.text: This place was probably the worst disappointment of our Vegas trip.  We stayed at Palazzo and wandered over to the Venetian's faux Italy world for dinner.  They had numerous little "outdoor" cafes to choose from, Wolfgang Puck, Mario Batali, and other famous chefs so, we figured any one of them would be extraordinary.    We opted for this little place due to my Italian food obsession.  We ordered 2 pasta dishes (TAGLIATELLE ALLA CASTELLANA and LINGUINE ALLA BURANELLA) , the first was very underdone and bland and other was a hot garlic mess.  Really, for the price, I've had better food at The olive Garden

JNRKGYYbvkvbDQp_gMqmdA.text: Nothing really stood out about this Italian restaurant. I went with a group of 6 without reservations and we were quoted 30 minutes. No big deal since we all had to refresh. My two friends went to go smoke, my other two went to the bar where some lady said: lets all have some shots. They thought the person who said lets have some shots was paying, but the bartender brought them a tab for their Patron shots- about $25 bucks each. Watch out for that gimmick, maybe the bar fly was placed there by the restaurant to increase bar sales. They only serve olive oil with their bread, no vinegar, so we helped ourselves to the bottle of vinegar hanging on the side of a waiter station. The menu seemed to have been written in Italian and thankfully the menu items had descriptors in English. My friend ordered the squid ink risotto that had shrimp and cuttle fish. The entire dish looked like shit on a plate the way it was presented. I had a taste b/c he raved about it but it tasted like day old fish. Like the way rotten fish smells that's how it tasted. I almost threw up and instantly became nauseous.  My friend had a ham and mozzarella calzone that was pretty tasty. I had angel hair w. bolognese. It was good, but they were skimpy on the sauce. I didn't try the other dishes. The entire meal came to 175. 6 entrees plus a bottle of wine.  Not sure why this place was so lackluster, but I'm sure to never go back.

HDrbedAKSbXF1_PJcKbpfw.text: Can't say I was a fan. The wine was great, but...  Our house salad was bland and wilted.  My roasted chicken was bland and tasteless. Our server was... Well... Kinda went like this:  Server: Is everything well?  Us: Yes, but could we get a glass of wat-  Server: Is everything well? (to the table beside us, not even listening to us).   It took us two attempts to get his attention before we finally got our water. In addition, when he gave us our bill, he was a little too concerned that we give him an excellent review for his service on their online survey.  Yeah, just not a fan. :/

JFnuzo_q233Y7VBMA_aqXw.text: Well another nice dinner at Canaletto! Truly a great atmosphere when out on the "patio". I've never actually sat inside for dinner as the primary joy of this restaurant is the faugh outdoor seating.   Dress can be from nearly black tie to causal, just don't show up in swim shorts and flip flops!  There is usually live music, flute and violin, on weekend nights which is very nice. People meandering through St. Mark's Square really bring s the full Italian street restaurant ambiance. Without the pigeons!  A couple of drinks for two, two entrees', desert and digestifs, with tip about $150. Not your everyday affair but not bad for a nice night out.  Food is generally above average, but some expect more because he restaurant presents a much more refined atmosphere. If you get something you don't like or didn't order, be polite and send it back or ask for the manager. This is Vegas. If done right, you'll get treated right.  Servers always seem to be FOB from Europe if not Italy directly. Very polite, but in fashion that seems brusk to many who haven't been to Europe. Also, they leave you alone to let you enjoy your meal and your time there. You may have to ask for something as servers aren;t at your table every five minutes trying to usher you out.

LYbtGBceShVRze_aNDO3TA.text: Amazing place.  Absolutely authentic Italian. Vito the waiter is a typical affable and friendly Italian. Very personable. The food is excellent. It just feels like you are back in Italy.

_uDC8YdNgGb5NBZvOJ81Bg.text: The best Italian restaurant in Vegas.  A some food, fresh, amazing location. Great service.  Definitely 5 stars restaurant.

tprn0ID1wDIyM01QDUS3yg.text: We had a big breakfast and happened to be taking a tour of several casinos trying to win some money. After touring around, we stumbled in the court area with this restaurant during their happy hour special.  The atmosphere was amazing as it was in the court area where singers would perform several times a day plus near the canals in the Venetian. The happy hour special was only offered at the bar starting at 3 pm. We were lucky to be seated at a private high table between the bar and the patio dining area.  The food was amazing for the value. Appetizers and pizza were under $10 while the drink specials were $5 or less. We order a pizza, 2 appetizers and drinks. There were other things to view near the area but both of us were happy with our find. Definitely worth the value if you happen to be in the area during happy hour.

SX7H31OsX6Ebe-ZxHzAHjg.text: Good food BUT. 1- Seats were dirty 2- Hair in the napkin/tissue 3- They treat customers with attitude. I had the worst welcoming ever.

Np4e1XQc-afoJ5ZgBVhGCA.text: Great food and great service. If you get the chance to be waited by Kurt, you will be in for a treat. He will make your Vegas trip worth it no matter how much money you lose in blackjack.

msPmOG7Bcr5nTIgGZQlzCQ.text: I'm afraid I have to lower Canaletto a peg.  It may have just been mainly what I ate this time.  Homemade light Minestrone Di Verdura Soup was good; Insalata Cesarina with a light Caesar Dressing was excellent; and crusty Italian bread and rolls were really good with butter.  Roasted Potatoes were very good, as well.  But what was supposed to be the piece de resistance--a whole salt-encrusted Branzino--was just a very moist but rather bland fish.  And, once it was deboned, it reduced down to a smaller edible portion than I expected.  Plus, I still wound up with 4 bones in my mouth on different bites.  Service was otherwise excellent; the ambiance on the patio of The Venetian's St. Mark's Square with electronic violins playing nearby was very nice; and Crespelle Di Mele was once again an excellent dessert, with Colombina al Cioccolato very good as well, as a second sweet ending for my party of four.  But next time I will return to mussels and pasta!

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt-Encased Branzino
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A Pleased Diner
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scaloppine Ortolano

NLScMFOZ1Uc3NMl4gp0eug.text: Crap service, over priced cousine , for better food go across the street to something better, tiny shitty bar as well

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GpisQZGYI0AEch1RzAiiEw.text: For a quickie Italian but not authentic....this is decent. But honestly I wouldn't come back.  I can't even do a full review because there really isn't much I can say.  I've had better.  Oh and their risotto was not good at all.  It was undercooked. Do people taste their cooking?

NJ3UGx-uBAcIq00WnRTHeQ.text: The food and service at this place were awesome. We couldn't decide where to go as there are so many choices in the venetian/palazzo!  Our waiter was an older man with an accent that made it really feel like an Italian place!  We started with the bread with oil & vinegar- the rolls with the olives in them were perfectly balanced.  Then we shared the caprice salad - the fresh mozzarella couldn't have been better and paired well with the fresh basil and tomatoes.  Then I had a risotto that had beef tenderloin, mushrooms and parmesan cheese in it - it was mouth watering good.  The other person with me had their signature calzone - I had more than a bite of it because it was that good and was oozing cheese!  The prices here were more than reasonable especially for the exceptional service.  If you needed a plate taken away or a glass refilled they were there before you could ask!  Sitting in the promenade area getting to see one of the Carnevale shows at the same time made this experience perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful restaurant

2IhOZTzcrQsRCYNKYuMbEg.text: I should start this review by saying that the pasta here is incredible. My boyfriend and I ate here on our last night in Las Vegas because we were craving some good house made pasta and we were not disappointed. However, we received terrible service at this restaurant and, considering it was not an inexpensive meal, this should not have happened and was extremely upsetting.   My boyfriend and I look young (we are relatively young) but we have no problem spending money on a good meal. First, when we sat down, the waiter immediately came over and took away our wine glasses and the wine menu before asking if we wanted anything to drink. Uh... We did but you took our menus and glasses. He commented that we looked very young and he needed to see ID. We gladly showed it to him and he served us our wine. IDing me is not a problem but I was annoyed that he took our drink menus and glasses without asking.   After we ordered drinks, he must have come back about every 30 seconds to ask if we were ready to order yet. We felt rushed as we decided on appetizers and entrees. Thank god the food was amazing because I would have been pissed otherwise. We ordered Bruschetta, Gnocchi Formaggi, and Gnocchi al Ragu. The Gnocchi Formaggi was incredible.   As we ate our meal we noticed our waiter go to two different tables next to us to welcome them and read out the specials. I was a little annoyed before but I didn't think about it too much until the point. He certainly had not spent any time welcoming us into the restaurant and he definitely hadn't read us a single special. We were pretty insulted that he didn't seem to think we were worthy of basic restaurant etiquette.   Our waiter disappeared for the rest of the night until our plates had been taken away. We declined an offer for dessert but ordered two more glasses of wine. When he brought our drinks back he commented that we "really should order a dessert with that." Pretty sure I already said no thank you?   As my boyfriend and I finished our wine and debated on getting a coffee, the waiter dropped the check on our table which made up our minds for us.   Honestly, we enjoyed ourselves at this restaurant. The food was incredible and the restaurant itself is very pretty. It was a great way to end our trip and I would definitely recommend it. But it's simply not fair to neglect a paying customer because of their age.

QWLe-W_WpYzemq4ky3Wkbg.text: I'm hard pressed to give it a 4 star rating and would love to give it a solid 3.5, however, it's not possible. So, For this "review" I'll stick to the 4.    My salmon was grilled nicely, the presentation of carrots and green beans  with roasted potatoes was appealing, yet, it didn't blow my socks off.  It was a safe meal for tourists who enjoy simple foods without "spice." There was a light sauce drizzled on the salmon that is have liked more of actually.   The bar and outside seating is right above the gondolas which gives one a fun view.   I was also served FAST and immediately which is a rarity in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon lunch.

_inWp6SulkzjcA6oMdO4rQ.text: Like a number of other experiences in Las Vegas, Canaletto is a restaurant which should offer a top quality meal and experience in a creative upscale environment.  While we found the food quality to be good, the execution wasn't up to par for the price point of the restaurant.  We were a tad early for our 6pm reservation - oops, didn't seem to read the note that we wanted to sit "outside".   Oops, didn't remember to bring you a glass of water without asking (it's Vegas in July for heaven's sake!)  The bread basket was generous, fresh and served with olive oil - oops, didn't offer balsamic vinegar (like other tables received).  We asked for the latter and it was mixed with the oil rather than offered in a jar or a separate dish.  We painstakingly reviewed the wine options and asked for 2 glasses off the specials menu - oops, didn't tell you that none of those are available, you need to choose from the wine list.  We ordered the grilled polenta as an appetizer - oops, didn't think to offer it with a bit of red sauce to accompany it.  Our main courses of grilled free-range chicken and sea bass (bronzino) were both very good and served hot with a side of spinach.  I think that this would be a great place for a group as there is room for a larger table, sitting "outdoors" allows for one to boisterous and the little details wouldn't matter as much.  However, for a couples night out, we found ourselves let down by the service and attention to detail.  If one does choose to sit outside in St Marks Square, just keep in mind that when the performers start, it can be quite noisy.  Canaletto is not inexpensive and I think that we just were expecting a better overall experience.  That said, it's still a nice setting and reasonable experience.  4 for the food, but 2 for the service - so, overall, a 3.

IXf5D12AkIjp0JzrvaB_aw.text: We made a reservation a few months ago for my daughters 21st Birthday party. We had a party of 9 with 2 children. We asked to be seated in the outside which was great for people watching and the Venation has a wonderful atmosphere.  Our waiter was very professional and handle our table to perfection. He brought us some olive oil and some great and I thought we could have just ate that and been perfectly content.   I tried the Goulash over Pasta and it was out of this world. The pasta is obviously made on site because it was to die for and very fresh. We had about 6 different dinners from Italian to Steak and no one had anything but to say but it was the best. My wife and daughter both got a different kind on gnocchi  and  they loved it also.  When it was time for desert my granddaughter went and told our  waiter that it was my daughters 21st BDay and they quickly brought out a Tiramisu desert with a candle and we were able to sing to her which she loves. A few people got the desserts and all had rave reviews.   Great place all the way around. It is not cheap but worth the indulgence.

HkgPfVBftOkjcscB0jI6Jw.text: A group of 10 of us came here for dinner after a show. Our waiter James was amazing and so accommodating. We asked for separate checks and he was more than happy to do so. He was extremely attentive and funny. The food was excellent we ended up passing a lot of the items around to taste and they were great. We were seated on the "patio" and there was a musical performance going on in front of the stores. It was awesome. We did have one little issue with one dish that had mussels and clams. Majority of the clams were not opened which they should be when cooked so my friend brought it to James attention. James returned with a large plate of freshly cooked mussels and clams for her! We had a great dinner to say the least and we loved James!

RWpCqQlTT0PRCn2OK71vWg.text: Very nice almost entirely romantic spot! Felt kind of like in Italy. The food was great! Would definitely come back!

4grSQsXkB7chKyJvbw49-g.text: Ordered the calamari and the seafood linguine to split. The complimentary bread assortment was tasty, though I personally thought their balsamic vinegar was too sour.  The calamari was lightly breaded, with the most amazing marinara sauce I wanted to take home with me. It came with a polenta square which I didn't quite understand. The seafood pasta was delicious, a little oily but with a generous amount of seafood.  We were seated in the "outdoor patio" area and were fortunate enough to catch an opera performance while we were dining.  Bill came out to about $50 without drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood linguine
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free bread

A08WAMq_bm-cz1LdR_fF2w.text: Really disappointing. I have eaten there 5 times and it has deteriorated. I do not mind overpaying for good food but they need to upgrade their food. The pasta had so much garlic it was not edible by either me or my partner. The salad greens were not fresh. Everything is $5 to $10 dollar over priced and I am done going there anymore.

jPeiQc5hb6HV0z_sbWnuOg.text: We were going to watch a show at the Venetian and was looking for a place to eat. I saw the Happy hour at the entrance to this place and we decided to try it out.  We were pointed to the bar area. We sat and the bartender came up right away and offered us the happy hour menu. We ordered pizza and calamari and a couple of beers.  The pizza was great and so was the calamari. You could actually order one whole pizza for one person, it was only $7.  We were able to watch the show at the Canal. The place is right in the middle of the Venetian Canal, so, the view and the ambiance was really nice. We are locals and we always look for this good deals and we were glad we found this one. We already came back 3 times.

A4MK453YGuYEiHi0pMWrgA.text: Our group of 7 dropped by on a casual Sunday and was promptly seated even though the place was packed. All I want to say is that this place has some AWESOME Squid Salad! I wasn't in the mood for a heavy meal since I just ate at a buffet earlier on in the day. I asked the waitress for recommendations and she said that the Polipo con Patate is one of her favorite. Bingo! It was absolutely delicious. The octopus was tender and flavorful and the potato salad + the acidity complemented the octopus well. $15 is definitely pricey for an appetizer but the portion is decent as well. Other in my party tried out various dishes from the pastas to the risottos to the vegetarian dishes and everyone was satisfied with their meals.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Polipo con Patate

q6KWAwaIJnqcCCqr7u0ocA.text: We had a very tasty lunch at Canaletto. The $25 prix fixe menu was a great value. I ordered the salad, pizza, and black cherry gelato. The pizzas are large enough for two people and appear to be prepared in a brick oven. For the other entrees, they appeared to be fairly small; however, my parents indicated that the gnocchi were some of the best they've had. We intend to return there again during our stay at the Venetian. The ambiance is excellent, it is located very close to the gondolas and live entertainment started even at lunch time. The waiter was very pleasant and attentive. I would highly recommend for a relatively inexpensive three course meal with beverage included.

N60jA0G7fSDgZ2aLIimfCA.text: It's not hard to find amusement, but good and affordable food are as rare as a thunderstorm in sin city. Enter Canaletto. Situated in the Venetian, which by the way is my favorite hotel, Canaletto and its italian cuisine perfectly match the rest of the environment.  Luckily, we reserved: when we got there there was a 45 minute wait. However, the gentleman at the entrance was not too gentle just because we asked for a table 'outside' and he didn't have one.  Once seated, our waitress was very kind and she accomodated our request to eat in a reasonable amount of time since we had to attend a show later on.  Appetizers - Fried Mixed Vegetables: the frying was light and the vegetables were very tasty. As Italian, I never tasted fried tomatoes but that didn't disturb the overall flavor of the plate - Herb and Taleggio Flan (special of the day): if you love cheese and it's on the specials menu, you must have this! Hot cheese mixed with vegetables....yum!  Entrees: - Branzino al Prosecco e Zafferano: the branzino was delicate and cooked to perfection. The menu promised mashed potatoes but got spinach instead :( - Risotto Sant'Erasmo: we couldn't really taste the crab, but other than that the risotto was perfect.  Overall we were very pleased with the dinner and the price.  If you are in the mood for Italian and you find yourself near the Venetian, I think Canaletto is your best choice.

tOxgNhhuZsR1I8OJ04pNOA.text: Bad service! Food was not even mediocre! This placed rocked years ago, yet has gone downhill pretty hard! Really sad!

Mrj78HT-I3y3TqIMvw8t-A.text: Terrible service, mediocre food. Attitude everywhere. Hated our experience here. It felt like once the staff realized that English wasn't the first language of our party they became irritated. Writing this review is making me angry.

CGyrqcbkAgHuYNgUBv_HYw.text: Love the location of this restaurant.  Sitting "outside" on the cobblestone and under the "clouds" makes it feel just like you are in Italy.

trdBbZaup19esb6ANVsqaQ.text: This is not a top restaurant in any way, more like an average lunch joint in my home Town  I ordered a bottle of sparkling water, I never got it. I didn't get my appertizer until I asked for it and that was after all others had finished their first course. By that time my warm tomatoes with mozzarella was Cold tomatoes with mozzarella.  Just an "I'm sorry" from the waitress nothing else I was hungry and not in the mood for an argument or a fight.  I already had my doubts about this place....  My main course was grilled fish with vegetables.  The fish was OK but nothing special  The vegetables were overcocked.  My brother got micro heated spagetti dish, at least it felt that way he told me, it was like a skin Surface on top of the food.  In every way average but what could you expect for a restaurant in that size?

UUOPeynJsXz1ennj4WhsQQ.text: Dined at Canaletto with a group and we had a fantastic table on the patio out by the square. So fun! Started with some drinks and an amazing seafood platter! Crab legs, lobster, shrimp, mussels, and crab claws. Wow. Went for the insalata di pere. I loved it. Great combo of flavors. For dinner I had the pear ravioli with walnuts, sauce was rich but not too thick. The asparagus added a nice crunch and flavor. Husband went for the bone in ribeye. He liked it. The only thing that didn't wow were the side of white beans with the steak. Not bad, just not as much flavor as i expected with how great everything else was. I tried a friends risotto. Wow, it was the one with beef and mushrooms, amazing depth of flavor. Service was good. The whole table loved the meal. I would totally go back. And, the mgr was nice enough to show us a quick way to get another hotel for our show.

8zTApwogiUWn6rAAQEzO6g.text: "Super Delicious!!!"  This restaurant is located in the Venetian Hotel. The ambiance is exquisite and the food is out of this world. The service is top of the line. If you are looking for a place that serves excellent Italian food where you don't have to dress up (jackets for men) then this is the place for you. Both my husband and I will definitely return.   Visited July 2013

v9RvHvceZeTaqOS7qrGDsA.text: The restaurant is beautiful restaurant inside and out.  Great menu choices.      The homemade ravioli with pear and asparagus was very good.   Excellent service.  Friendly staff.

150UFysw8v__rD7jMo012Q.text: We started off our evening at Canaletto with some time at the bar before our reservation. We had a party of five and were waiting for the other two to arrive. I ordered some Makers Mark neat and a very healthy pour arrived (yay booze!). Other members of my party ordered a bottle of wine which was said to be a good deal and a glass of white wine. I can not vouch for either of those since I stuck to the Makers.  When the five of us were seated our waiter seemed a little.....out of it. We got some more drinks, and wine and ordered.  I ordered the selection of artisanal cheeses, which is a favorite. It arrived some time later with four types of cheese: A blue, two types of parmesan or romano and another which may or may not have been fontina. It was accompanied by crostini, some preserves and grapes. A nice little spread. Another glass of Makers Mark arrived with it as well. So far so good.  For my entree I chose something light, enabling the consumption of more Makers Mark. The tenderloin risotto with wild mushrooms was pretty exceptional. Perfectly cooked and expertly seasoned. I didn't eat all of it but did finish another glass of Makers Mark.    There was no dessert.  Other members of my party were getting quite loud at that point and we decided that it might be time to go since they weren't seating any more tables near us.   Overall the experience and food was great, drink superb and the prices here are really reasonable for the Vegas strip. My risotto was $20 and the cheese plate was $15. Cant remember the price of the Makers.  Waiter never quite had it together but whatever, it seemed like four stars at the time.

EsXIpj31r_mK6VNw7UQy0w.text: Delicious food!! The place is run by Italians! I had a plate of gnocchi with pesto, amazing!! Real pesto, the real Italian taste! We spent 35$ each for a pizza/pasta and wine. The location is superb!

zTV4asnrKTRHZQqSFKYV9g.text: One of the best meals we had in Las Vegas. Our waiter was very helpful, recommend a great red wine for me, and we had a nice conversation about him growing up in Italy (I lived in some of the same areas he grew up in). The service was excellent to say the least.  I had the mixed seafood grill and was not disappointed. The fish was fresh and cooked perfectly, the scallops were well seasoned and flavorful, and the giant prawn was one of the best I've ever had. Overall, a wonderful dining experience and a restaurant that we'll eat at on our next trip to Vegas.

CR4WV4Ag-uJDA296Yp0qlA.text: The food here is AMAZING. By far my favorite meal in a long time. I had the ricotta gnocchis and they were some of the best I've ever had in a restaurant. The setting is really nice, we sat "outside" in the square. Great service too!

sNaXq2bqizFJ3q7A1D4qLQ.text: Who needs Red Bull when you got an artificial beautiful day at the Venetian?   Came here by an invite by an old friend for a couple of drinks. I don't know if drinks are usually served strong but that is how it came in my glass. Seemed like a busy spot, and well central to the Canal Shops.  We ordered the Oysters and Beef Carpaccio. Oysters were actually pretty delicious, I must say, as I am far from a fan of these pearl makers. I ate one up with some cocktail sauce and a hint of lemon and horseradish, so it wasn't a pure act of bravery, but it was good going down.  Beef Carpaccio was good, with the capers, arugula and cheese on top. I've had better myself, but it was far from worth complaining about.  Those are all I've tried at this spot but I wouldn't forego going again. Even though it was 9pm, we felt reenergized by the brightness of the ceiling and the pigeons that somehow snuck into the Canal Shops made it more authentic. Eating and drinking with friends at night in such an atmosphere was a nice touch.

WSLNXgTpSriOqDaaDebdGg.text: Went here last nite. I had veal which was tasteless. There were three of us and each agreed the the food was dissapointing. The location is amazing and would imagine they survive by new customers. I wouldn't think locals would come back here.

6iNgxmlO1DYKL5BLERczjw.text: We asked for a salad and pizza. He only brought the pizza. When we said we asked for a salad as well, he said "oh well I didn't hear you" and proceeded to walk away. We watched him write it down..

xlxtJTkl1ZTkMUX4Y8UcHQ.text: Ordered squid ink risotto and seafood linguine. They were under cooked and tasted alright. Had half portion as they were good.  Will not recommend this place and will not return.

oyZ9EgBZZXEPjlrbY2UvqA.text: Great atmosphere in the Grand Canal area, lots of seating (albeit, kinda tight in my opinion), and good food. :)   Antipasti:  Sardee in Soar - very good! a little too lemony, but good overall. Formaggio dal Veneto - oh my, the blue cheese was very very strong! but the others were very delish! Carpaccio con Ruchetta  - oh how can you go wrong with carpaccio? theirs is very well made. :)   Entrees: iThe Fettuccine alla Castellana was very good.. mmm i could still taste it.. the oils weren't too overpowering, and the tastes & textures were very complimentary to each other.   the Pizza Cristina, was very generous with the truffle oil (and we are not complaining!!),  the Pizza con Salsiccia, was very good as well.. the sauce wasn't too overpowering, it had a perfect sweet and spiciness to it..   We were all thoroughly full and satisfied at the end of our meals. We would definitely come back for more.. And we just learned that there is also a Canaletto in Newport Beach, close to home! Yay!

0N_-RXFkQ0YrlSgseS9R0A.text: The food is good here. As an Italian I know I can count on a good risotto and a good pasta. For me that's a basic requirement at an Italian place. The service was good and we were inside, away from the crowds, which was a bonus.

f5MOQjFJIXzsY0tB_HsHRQ.text: Service, was ok.. Our waiter was not very welcoming, nor was he very helpful. (We had to ask other waiters for beverage refills & more bread) It also seemed as if our waiter got mad when we didn't order dessert.  Food, was good.. (If you are looking for a meal on the cheaper side, this would not be the place unless it's happy hour.) Overall it was good for myself and close friends for fine dinning.

pd81T3VASHBYQzlXacCy1A.text: Canaletto; next to the mini canal of Venetian hotel.   You feel the Italian aura right at the door, when one of the waiters yells, "ciao bella, come estai? " and some other hot italian phrases (Italian just sounds too hot *hot flashes*)   *puts some cold water on her face and comes back to review*   First thing is the great service; one greats you, one seats you, and one takes care of your food and you ....*ahem*  (romantic Italian music for soundtrack...)  I had very delicious dining experience at Canaletto because they have simply good food that smells great under the "fake" sky of the Venetian hotel.   They have their own baked bread, crunchy, and tastes great with virgin olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Our appetizer was Prosciutto and melon and parmigiano cheese. Good starter with rich smoked flavor of prosciutto and parmesan cheese with that golden melon, was very refreshing and prepares you well for the entrees.  We got proseccos. I have to confess; I love proseccos more than champaign, there! I said it. It's such a refreshing and pleasant wine-type that makes you love Italy even more. Doesn't have the bitterness of champaign, leaves a pleasant aftertaste and nice buzz for LV.  My main dish was seafood Pastizzio. Very drooling and very flavorful. Pink creamy sauce, with the seafood smell all over, baby clams, baby shrimps, mussels, and  scallops.  It's a great place to try as one of your restaurant explorations by being in LV and walking around the Venetian shoppe area, under that fake sky. (Which I can't get over it).  Arrivederci!  p.s. My group loved their food as well. I have picture to prove them.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my friend&#39;s salmon dish
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. seafood pastizzio
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the menu

gANVWAsG8MC-dOReTpYTWw.text: We eat here everytime we are in Las Vegas Great atmosphere Great Food!

Qj8Bvk45BbDq_jLygtkhdQ.text: I've been here twice during lunch for both of my Palazzo stays and both times were great.  The food is delicious!  Probably one of my favorite restaurants to have lunch at.  The prices are somewhat decent for Las Vegas, but you're in vegas just go win some money.  They also give you complimentary bread to eat with olive oil and vinegar?   I really recommend the POLIPO CON PATATE (Octopus with potato salad), Cristina pizza (Thin flat bread with proscuitto), and any of the risottos are a m a z i n g.  Pair them with some Riesling and you've got a great meal.  Came here hungover, left happy.  Also, the atmosphere is quite lively as some singing and shows happen during noon - pretty cool to eat with live entertainment.  Usually I take pictures of my food but I forgot to save it from snapchat. Ill update my review with pictures in the future as I'm sure I will be back.

92TBLdGQYQ5XoA2kUZCQfw.text: Invited as part of a company function(group of 60 or so). The service was very very good, fast and friendly. That being said, let's talk about the food. My steak was cooked to perfection, my wife had chicken risotto which was not good at all, bland flavor and little if any chicken. For desert, we all had the tiramisu. The texture was off and they were very heavy handed with the coco powder. The menu was preset for the event so I can not speak on other menu items. I am not inclined to go here again. Many better choices when in Vegas.

OdOhk9BVpXv18jrxou6r0w.text: Stopped in this place in the Venetian for happy hour drinks and a light snack before heading to a wedding.  The drinks were strange.  You could only get certain ones.  Which I totally get but they were all strange concoctions.  I wanted a regular martini, but could only get strange flavored ones.  So that's what I ordered and didn't really like it.  Our waiter was less than attentive and made us feel that because we were shopping off the happy hour menu, we were less worthy of his time.  The margarita pizza was delicious though and that's why I gave it at least a 3 star rating.  This would have probably been a cool place to have a full dinner.

T_x9H3g2uq82YBJ3Kbcx0g.text: Food: 3.0/5.0 Service: 3.5/5.0 Value: 3.0/5.0 Decor: 3.0/5.0 Overall: 3.0/5.0   Good spot for a quick meal but I wouldn't come here for much more than convenience.  Fake accents, anyone?

_Gicic4e5rO1v6zADiFTSQ.text: This restaurant is such a perfect spot for group dining in Vegas.  They have good prices, good service, and great food.  I have been here more than once, and on both occasions I have sat in the "outdoor" area.  I guess it's not really outdoor since you are in the hotel, but you feel like you are outdoor because you are sitting under the blue Venetian hotel sky.  This is a perfect place to sit to people watch, listen/watch any performances, etc.  They provide you with bread, olive oil and balsamic upon seating.  I recommend the free range chicken breast for people opting for a light meal, or the canneloni di pollo pasta dish or tagliatella alla castellana or sausage pizza.  I haven't had anything bad here yet.  The portion sizes are also large.  I have not had dessert here yet.  All around a place I will always keep returning to in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

al-ceGwoBMbOkr7gmN_dfQ.text: Came here to eat dinner before the Celine Dion show. We sat at the patio and glad we did. There were live singers across the way and just the atmosphere was very inviting outside.  We ordered the Penne, cannelloni, tagliatelle pastas as well as the petto di pollo. All were delicious, but the Cannelloni was the best. The staff were super friendly and funny. We were stuffed after the meal.  They also have happy hour at the bar from 4-6pm on Sunday through Thursday.

S8ozmPuEILsWrf73HLNRUw.text: Really like and enjoy this restaurant.  Always eat here when I get to Vegas.  Seated earlier, great waitstaff, prompt service and food.  Had the caprese (better then last visit and excellent) and the gnocchi bolognese this time which was well done.   All around everyone likes this dinner and will return.

NvaPc574SEvQr8zQgWEtpQ.text: Canaletto is a gem. It's a restaurant that you must dine at when you are in Las Vegas. Of course it has its sister restaurants Il Fornaio at the NY NY HOTEL. Canaletto is situated in the Venetian Resort and Casino. It is located in the St. Marks Square. So if you are sitting outside in the courtyyard, you have that amazing view of St. Marks Square and of the singers that come out to sing every hour. If you happen to sit inside, you can definitely get a glimpse of the gondolas. The food and staff are amazing. That's something you will rarely hear from me that both are amazing. One of my favorite waiters there is Jean Carlos. If you ever get him, he's the best. Of course all the waiters, waitresses and staff are incredible. Now, the food is just breathtaking and full of genuine Italiano Flavor. What I would recommend is the seafood linguine or if they offer the risotto. The dessert is the signature of Canaletto which is their Tiramisu. Have I had any place make the best Tiramisu ever/??? Not as fresh and authentic as Canaletto. Come try the Italian Cuisine at Canaletto and it will be an experience you will never forget. I have been coming here since they first opened. This is truly a remarkable place.

zslYl_v-CDdOllyj2tmCxQ.text: This place saved our Christmas. I went here after a horrible experience at Caesar's Palace. I was prepared for the worst because it was nearly 8pm on Christmas Day and I didn't have reservations. I walked up to the hostess and asked for a table for 5 at the patio because it's pretty there and they had carolers at the courtyard.   To make the long story short, despite that busy night, they were still able to seat us within 30 mins.  The service is awesome and their food , especially the rib eye is exceptional.   Amazingly, they also serve craft beer!!!  I can't wait to go back to Vegas and eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had beer, wine, and coffee
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RxdE4KBAzZTgsEtuo-QyaQ.text: Place is  yummy and their tiramisu is one of the better ones I've tried.  Service was great as they checked up on us enough and we had a pleasant experience.  Pricey but overall, your getting a great environment with good food

RF9wqYv6g4991RWa28Z9Qw.text: Great location inside of the Venetian where you can enjoy the beautiful ambiance of the hotel. If you sit "outside" you have a great view of the courtyard. We even had a view of the stage and were treated to some dinner entertainment going on in the square. There were kings, queens, jesters, violinists and singers. Quite lovely. The service was excellent. The wine or water glasses were never empty and the food came out relatively quickly. My pasta and meatballs was pretty average. Nothing to write home about here. Everyone seemed to enjoy their food and had a lovely time dining at this restaurant. I would recommend this place based on it's excellent view during dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti w/Meatballs
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta ya&#39;ll

k6uIyfE4COKpTnGFQ_O9Nw.text: Had dinner here for a large group.  Food: was ok. Nothing to write home about. Price: A little pricey but then again everything is pricey on the strip.  Service: polite

_LkxJYdJBvJOxR57eIPr9w.text: Thankful the Venetian doesnt charge for parking! My brother-n-law put together a surprise dinner here for my sisters birthday, and I was a bit hesitant because the strip and charging for parking isn't the business for locals.   Anyways, dinner was great. My first time here and it exceeded my expectations. We had a private room over looking the Grand Canal Shops and the place setting on the table was wonderful. The view was great too.   Service was prompt. They handled or drink orders in a timely manner. Refilled our drinks quick. Our food was brought out quickly too. Everything we ordered to share was delicious.   This place is a bit pricey, but that's to be expected being on the strip.   Would I recommend this place? Yes. I would keep it in mind for another special occasion.

D1Dc1tnkfZVL5ihM1OQzgA.text: The rotisserie chicken was dry. I enjoyed the flavor but it was difficult to get through because of the lack of moisture. Had that been the only factor in my review, Canaletto would be a one star. I will say the service was great. Our waiter was friendly and responsive. He made the experience great even with the challenges with the main dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h5dW_pSaDDxroHHg-JFXxw.text: I had brunch with my friends. I really liked the location and atmosphere of the restaurant. The food was amazing but drinks were expensive

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4gV92Z81fn8qag-2qdVq6Q.text: I dined here with a large work group. The servers willingly accommodated last minute changes to our guest count which we appreciated because the restaurant was quite busy.   Our group of twelve ordered items across the menu and everyone was still complimenting the food on the following day. I had the beet salad and the mixed seafood grill both of which were well prepared and perfectly seasoned. I could see the kitchen from my seat, and it was obvious that they meticulously prepared each dish. The pasta was all freshly made in house, as it should be.   I never know what to expect with themed restaurants in Vegas, and Canaletto was impressive across the board.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled seafood skewer with prawns, salmon, calamari, scallops, polenta and more

NjgK34vYs0S5cAswzxaBMg.text: I found this restaurant using the app Open Table because I was looking for a nice restaurant to celebrate my boyfriends birthday, and this made it easy for me to make a reservation. And I am so happy I did.   The neat thing about this place is you sit "outside" which is basically the ambiance of Italy but inside a casino in the middle of the desert lol.   The drinks were a little pricey for my liking but they tasted amazing so it was hard to complain. But the food however, delicious. The names of the dishes are in Italian so be sure to read what follows or else you won exactly know what you're ordering. Everything was fresh and delicious. Thank goodness we saved this for the last day of our trip so I could take the leftovers.   Thanks open table for having such great restaurants listed in your app!

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3Pw24A7AP9QGOe-l7tFAVQ.text: That was the worst spaghetti and meatballs ever!!!!!! My wife had spaghetti with seafood and she didn't like it either.  The only good thing is we sat out in the court yard.  Note to self, don't go back.

y3fq13NCpzLva0DBRdxltQ.text: Had the seafood linguine, which was pretty good except for the mussels. My husband had the cannelloni and he liked his food. The service wasn't great, but we were having lunch on New Year's Eve. I don't think we'll return anytime soon. Interested in finding better Italian somewhere else on the strip...

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O8ot8PP24MBtcU6O-sd3aA.text: Their oyster is so fresh. We had a light dinner for 80 bucks, including tips. It took them around 20 minutes to cook the food we ordered. We were in a hurry so that is not satisfactory. The free bread is okay.

DafGTcdGZmu8Ri533rikSA.text: If I could give this place any lower of a rating, trust me, I would.  I can't speak on the quality of their food because the service was so awful that we didn't even stick around to order.  When we approached the restaurant, the host at the front didn't even acknowledge us and we actually had to go out of our way for her attention. Once we got her attention she had a rude and passive aggressive tone throughout the entire exchange. She sat us down at our table without a word. Nothing. We waited at our table for our server for well over 15 minutes and we were not acknowledged once. We don't even know who our server was supposed to be because they never showed up! Eventually we decided we would not give these people our business and our money and decided to leave. Upon exiting, we passed the same host and about three servers talking amongst themselves, clearly adamant on not making eye contact with us.  I generally ALWAYS give restaurants the benefit of the doubt when it comes to bad service and have never given a negative review on here but this experience was absolutely ridiculous.  We ultimately had our dinner at the restaurant next door, Mercato della Pescheria, and were immediately met with welcoming and easy going staff. Our evening at Mercato was wonderful and the food was great. If you've made it this far into my review, don't waste your time at Canaletto and take your business to their neighbors at Mercato della Pescheria.

rxIo_LP5gefulmWh9q7onw.text: Service moves pretty slowly here, so I was hungry by the time our food arrived and was ready to dig into my big plate of gnocchi with lamb ragu. Imagine my surprise when, instead of settling on the table in front of me, the gnocchi went sailing to the floor, splattering the back of my cream colored shirt with red sauce along the way.  These things happen and I understand that. But I would have expected a real apology and some form of make good from our huffy waiter, who acted genuinely upset with me for being in the way of my falling food. So I waited for a new plate of gnocchi to arrive and enjoyed the group's company. After we paid our $1500 bill, I walked over to my waiter and quietly asked if there was anything he could do for my shirt.  Here I'm thinking maybe $80 towards a new shirt, a comped bottle of their mediocre house red or even $10 to get the shirt cleaned properly. Guess what I got? A towel with some soda water and a little more attitude.  This incident notwithstanding, we had a fine meal Canaletto. But overall I'd agree wholeheartedly with previous reviewers: the ambiance here is pretty good, the food here is fine, the service poor and overall the prices are about 3x what they should be for this experience. If you're going to drop $100 or more per person for dinner, there are dozens of great options to choose from in Vegas... and I just can't see putting this place on the list.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iequfsKBV_2vi5eAkT0fAA.text: VERY cool atmosphere. We ate here for my boyfriend's birthday dinner. I had made reservations on OpenTable and requested a nice table off to the side and had also mentioned it was his birthday. They put me out of the way and even brought over chocolate cake with a candle. I was very impressed because I had made the reservations 3 months in advance!  Food was good. If you have time to linger, go here. We felt a little "ignored" at times. We didn't get bread right away and didn't see our server much but enjoyed sitting "outside"  - You really feel like you're dining Al fresco in Italy. I enjoyed it!

185eS2OGs3CfC-iSsEaGJQ.text: Honestly, this deserves 10 stars.  We have been coming here for 5+ years and it just gets better.  The menu is amazing.  The food is phenomenal.  But the VERY BEST PART is the service.  Nick and Aldo behind the bar are so kind.  Aldo is one of those people - happy, gracious - and he remembers you!!!  We literally come back to see him (and we live in SoCal so that's saying something). With all of the choices in Vegas, we choose Canaletto every time.  It's a special place.  Thank you for being so much a great destination for us!!  And thank you, Aldo!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QSDjLlM3B2XtstZsQet5xw.text: When reading reviews there is so much to take into consideration. I agree with others about Happy Hour and the bartenders are terrific. The inside of this restaurant is such a disappointment. It is comparable to a cafeteria but, with luxury pricing. We thought it would be romantic to sit inside. This is what we got... one side of the inside restaurant serves as a gateway to their outdoor seating. Waiters pass by  your booth like a human subway carting dirty dishes... its constant. So we moved to other side where the view of slobs, yes slobs are going back and forth to use the restrooms upstairs. What is wrong with people today? Its embarrassing and very distracting how people dress to eat a nice establishment. Throughout our meal we were subject to people using the inside of the restaurant  as a passage to the bathroom. Why does Canaletto even bother allowing sitting inside? Its just a well decorated corridor to the kitchen and the restrooms. We spent a lot of money and were so disappointed that I asked to see the manage who made us wait 20 minutes and then was so detached, no customer service skills and no interest in our disappointment. If he would have just offered us a cocktail we would have felt a bit better about wasting our money here. You do have better choices when it comes to dinner. In fact right next to Canaletto is a  much better experience.

sF1HtjLm4SzFl81lM9KS9g.text: This place is fine. Not great, not special, not bad. Just fine.  Sadly some of you think this is upscale Italian. No it is not. I would put this slightly below Maggiano's, and I would much rather go to Maggiano's than this place.  But it wasn't up to me, it was for the wedding party to decide. We went here for the reception dinner and it was ho hum. But most importantly the bride and groom had a good time so that's what counts. We had a separate room over looking the Square- er mall- and it was fine. The food was ok. Most of the steaks were overcooked and everything else was fine but nothing to write home about. The bread was amazing, warm and incredibly soft. The server really worked his tail off. He could have used some help at times as we were a party of 12.  This is what I would expect from your basic, yet overpriced, Vegas hotel/resort restaurant.

rvF_V6RHW0AYLIuUBotc7A.text: Canaletto isn't the best Italian in Vegas but it's certainly not the worst either. Be prepared to wait come dinner time - think we waited close to an hour. I got the cannelloni di pollo, which is pasta tubes filled with chicken, spinach, sundried tomatoes and mozz with tomato sauce. I think I would've liked it a lot better if the chicken was left out. My mom and sister both got risotto dishes and they absolutely loved it. My dad got a seafood dish and was on the fence just like me. Definitely better Italian in Vegas but as my three stars indicate, Canaletto is a-ok.

5TcJLR4eRj7KCFDnARoP1A.text: Went for Happy hour on Sunday- great deal on wine, cocktails, appetiZers at bar (7$)  . Great view  of the courtyard, good wine selection, had the bruschetta and carpaccio- both were delicious live music from the courtyard- overall great value

emuBgSMgvLxRWDcbaLY5yQ.text: Loved the atmosphere and loved the service! My husband and I stopped in for a night cap after dinner and then came back for a happy hour drink the next day. Both times we were met at the bar by Xavier. He gave us the most outstanding service!! He was very pleasant and actually talked to us about our trip. We were there for business and pleasure. It was nice to have him ask us about our trip and actually pay attention to what we said. He remembered us from the night before (which says a lot about Vegas). It was easy to see he enjoys what he does and even gave us some tips for our next trip. We will most certainly be back to say hi and have a glass of wine if only to say hello to Xavier. . Thanks!!

bnaRlraATAATPUOGXnKUtQ.text: Had a wonderful meal and fantastic service as always! One of our favorite places in Las Vegas and we always make time to go.... love the Calamari and the Meatballs as appetizers, I love the pear ravioli and my husband loved the Canaloni. Love the ambiance - a charming place in the middle of the hustle and bustle of The Venetian!

h423k83CRTj_Zn4FaiDe-Q.text: Great Ribeye.  Its a big meal for lunch.  Awesome wines.  You will enjoy yourself, sit in the outside seats.

qk1AVjt97JJzi3Do7w0aHQ.text: I had pear ravioli which sounded great - it was 'meh'.  Nice location in the Venetian, but I wouldn't eat there again.  Too much great food in Vegas.    Great service though.  Authentico!

n5w8a_B6K8NOa2Z97pZpGQ.text: Loved it! The Fish (sea bass) was prepared amazing and the sauce with capers, Oh my gawd!!!! It came with a bounty side of spinach and fingerling potatoes - the service was spectacular - the breads served with olive oil and balsamic was so yummy!!!!   I also sampled the chef's special which was a pasta dish and I wasn't crazy about it, but ordering off the menu was sufficient enough.....  A+ in my book!!!

r11o-1si6ltY3JujMSZCGQ.text: Not the top on my list for Authentic Italian food.  After coming to Vegas a few times I have always seen this place and wanted to stop it.  At last, we look at the menu and decided this was going to be our dinner one night.  We sat down inside and waited about 15 mintues before we were asked what we would like to drink.  We ordered:  CAPRESE Sliced vine-ripened tomatoes, fresh mozzarella and basil, drizzled with basil-infused extra-virgin olive oil 10.99   CALZONE Folded pizza filled with mozzarella, mushrooms, ricotta, ham and tomato sauce 15.59  LINGUINE ALLA BURANELLA Thin flat pasta with mussels, prawns, scallops and clams seasoned with tomatoes,crushed red pepper, garlic and trebbiano wine 24.99  and of course we received sample bread with a balsamic vinegar oil.  The waiter never asked if we were okay or needed anything else after ordering.  The linguine had very little sauce which made you tasting mosty just plain pasta.  Glad I went her eto make a dream come True but wont be back.

5-xpYauXyPui74pvqLEYeQ.text: The food is good, but this is the second time wen have came here and the service was horrible. Our Server, Gian-Carlo, older gentleman bald with glasses was horrible. First he never offered us any drinks after the bread was brought out it was about 10 mins before we were brought water. When the appetizers came out this guy was not being careful what so ever and was holding the platter by my mother in laws head where she had to lean to the side and when she did he brought the plate even closer to her ears. Barely checked up on us at all throughout the dinner. And all through out the dinner he never offered us drinks! At least we got water I guess..

odImFRA-8xV91km3SWs9vA.text: What a awesome place for HAPPY HOUR! From 3-6 pm, from Sunday to Thursday , their pizzas, appetizers, beer, wine and artisan drinks are all for $7!!! My gf and I came here twice and made friends with the bartender who was really helpful and friendly.  We ordered 2 martinis with passionfruit, calamari and beef carpacio and they were all great. Our bartender kept refilling our drinks as well which was totally awesome!!! Will definitely come back here again next time I'm in Vegas.

KZH0_60_2YaOTM4SEkcDRg.text: Not kidding. With all the great food choices in Vegas this place is beyond delicious!  Almost a MUST when you come to Vegas. And of course, the Venetian is pretty spectacular. There is nothing better than perfectly done Italian food! Go! And thank me later!

OcgRgrI4XdB0_c1aTRVPxw.text: Had a catered dinner here with 40 colleagues. Food was very good, service very good. Great location - even enjoyed a live string quartet playing in the "courtyard" outside the restaurant's entry.  Definitely would go again.

4CfY7nZQ8pLYLWkOTDebxQ.text: GREAT Service - our server was wonderful - attentive, but not hovering.  Canaletto is part of the Il Fornaio empire. Not a big deal to most, but if you do not like chains, just be aware.   The Canaletto menu was extensive, and did indeed remind us of an Il Fornaio. We visited as part of a school reunion group and the venue had several large tables so they were obviously well-equipped to handle larger parties. We were seated within the restaurant near the salad station and stairs to the restroom - it doesn't sound very nice, but it was surprisingly quiet and allowed everyone at the table to catch up and reminisce without having to shout, which was wonderful!  Again, our service - unfortunately I can't recall his name, but he was great.   We started with an Insalata di Pere (Arugula, radicchio, frisee, Belgian endive, grilled pears, grapes, blue cheese, toasted pecans, pomegranate dressing). The salad was nicely dressed and had a good flavor, but the pears were hard to find and the sweet of the fruit and dressing was not able to overcome (or even complement) the bitter of the greens.   Next, the gnocchi Bolognese (Potato dumplings with traditional meat ragu). The Bolognese sauce was lovely, but I had a bit of an issue with the size of the gnocchi - I realize that this is completely subjective, but they were too large. About double the size of traditional gnocchi (aka bize-size), I found myself having to cut them in two after stuffing the first whole piece in my mouth and fumbling to chew while looking like a chipmunk loaded down with nuts for the winter. Dainty and elegant, I was decidedly not.  Overall, a nice place and good food but with several other Italian options (hello, Otto and B&B) just steps away, Canaletto comes in a distant third.

0MivKC6AUgh-7YjZeQXUiw.text: okok... so i havent been to Las vegas in over 10 years, and now i had to come out for my company 4-day company holiday getaway.  Our actual XMas dinner was on Sat Night and about 150 of us had reservations for Canaletto "Buffet Style"  It was weird. Walking into the building from palazzo to venetian was crazy. The area in which Canaletto is located, has high ceilings painted like a Sky with Clouds, the common area looked like a street with Italian Canal, and the restaurant as if on a street in Italy. Buttttt.... No Smoking (even though its made to look and feel like youre outdoors).  At the restaurant, we started in the private rooms upstairs for open bar and cocktails with hors d'oeuvres. then downstairs where the entire restaurant was closed for us, and we got to eating.  No joke the food was ok. just ok. we had a selection of chicken, salad, beef, and fish. and like i said, it was ok. Cooked correctly, seasoned correctly. but basic.  I didnt feel it being better than usual.   but great staff. all friendly, willing to help and answer questions.

bpM-Aa5zkpgLFRijtl48qQ.text: So it is like being in Italy. The atmosphere was great with a violinist flute and singer. So start with 4 cheese gnocchi.  It was a great start as it is homemade. Flavors were total Italian comfort. Very well done.  Fiance had the veal that was perfectly cooked with good texture and flavor. I had roasted chicken.  Skin was crispy and moist on the inside. Everything was well cooked and I would recommend it for atmosphere and food was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from table

dYbm0x_SLLH9kyMTJd2tGQ.text: Came here for dinner late on a Saturday and didn't have to wait.  My fiance had a veal and polenta, which he seemed to like.  They were very accommodating with my dish -- I got the pasta ribbons, omitting the bacon and switching the cream sauce for tomato.  It was pretty good, though the pasta wasn't all that tender and the tomato sauce a bit salty.  But hey, I made the substitutions, so it's not the dish the chef means to serve, I guess.  I'm just happy that there was the option.  The amount of bread they give is very generous.  Service was nice but not particularly warm or anything.

QVFAJtTDUzK1lvFChZGsAQ.text: Couldn't have been worse. Food was HORRIFIC. Service was terrible. Overpriced garbage. NEVER AGAIN!!!  Got the chicken cannelloni; took an hour to get to table. It tasted like grade D chicken doused in powered milk and aged vegetables. I've literally never had worse food. How does an Italian place mess up pasta?!?!  TWO HOURS later we FINALLY get our server to bring check (even though we gave up on eating the crap after 20 minutes... we still had to wait for her to come around).  We asked for separate checks, and she acts all flustered, and takes ANOTHER 40 minutes to bring us the split checks. We each just ordered ONE Thing; why is that so hard?!?!  We were there for a business dinner, and while the company and conversations were great, we were all distracted from how horrific our food and service was.   DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY. Unless you have 5 hours to kill and no taste buds.

8MVBThaztM3F1fWOUedNQQ.text: So this place gets a full star above what I would give it just for the value.   I went to the bar happy hour from 4-6 and it was worth the trip. Pizza, drink, appetizer and salads are all 7 bucks each. So if you've had a long day of shopping or lost you rear at the table--eat here. The pizza was a notch above the unfrozen kind they sale at the grocery store and the bruschetta was bland. But here's the kicker. The wine or cocktails are also only 7 and they have some good choices. You are on the "street" at the venetians mall which gives you lots to look at. I recommend for a quick bite if you don't want an amazing experience but want good drinks, okay food and a great price.

XnVdqbI17DKP0cVRQlbDbQ.text: I like this place because of the ambiance, but the food was just ok. The pasta was a little rich on the flavor for me, but that only my opinion.  It a great place to chill out and it make you feel like your in Italy.

hZfL7vugRd7eWzpJSE47Tg.text: Right off the bat, the location of the restaurant grabbed out attention. Beautifully located in the middle of a huge courtyard inside the Venetian Shopping Center, it's a great scenery to have during your meal. On top of that, there is a stage/platform where performers will sing and act in the center of the courtyard.  Now for the food: Complimentary bread with oil and vinaigrette - 4 out of 5 stars. Main courses: Tagliatelle and Risotto beef tenderloin.   The Tagliatelle was decent. Pasta cooked well, a bit on the heavy side for cream sauce, and the pork was pretty dry - over cooked. I'd give it a 2.5 out of 5. The Risotto could have been in the pan a bit longer in my opinion. Other than that, it was delicious and the blend worked really well. Needless to say, I ate every grain on my plate.  Service was good, friendly, and comfortable. My only flaw in service was that I had to wait a few times for my water to be refilled.   Overall, a lot of options for pasta and antipasto to choose from, beautiful "outdoor" scenery, and friendly service. If you are looking for a relaxing meal, definitely dine here.

jz3mEqncF5tslu_jjyB95A.text: Dine outdoors in an inside sidewalk cafe.  Leave it to the magic of Las Vegas to make something like this even possible.  Canaletto is located among the shops and restaurants of the Venetian Resort.  In True Las Vegas style, the Venetian has turned an ordinary shopping mall into what appears to be an outdoor Italian village.  The main square, a nod to the real St. Mark's Piazza in Venice, is filled with musicians, painters, gondolas, and even a gelato stand.  There are three restaurants located along this square.  Canaletto has scored the best location to people watch and enjoy all the activities the square has to offer.  The food is, of course, Italian inspired with lots of pizza and pasta on the menu.  Pizza okay, crust was good and chewy, sausage and peppers just okay.  The pasta with mushrooms and a brandy cream sauce was pretty good, but not killer.    Most of the entrees are priced within reason, keeping in mind that these are resort prices.  After all, you are dining in Italy, I mean Vegas.  I'd give this place three stars for the food.  But it rightly deserves a fourth star for the unique and fun ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ambiance on the square, the primary reason to eat here.
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta with mushrooms in a cream brandy sauce.
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza with sausage and peppers.

tEiBEUh1RauspQwl1hq41w.text: I was a huge fan of this place, until I tried the scallop risotto with the natural black squid ink, which literally came out the same way all night during my special Vegas trip.  It tasted great at first, quite daring, and stopped less than halfway through, and it honestly ruined my trip thereafter.  I guess it was something about the ink mixed with the red wine, it just did NOT sit well.  As for the other 'inkless' items on the menu, they were delicious!  If you're craving seafood, avoid the black ink.

FZTpIcJr5o6o-PdZDwoZTA.text: My boyfriend and I were in a rush to find a place to eat inside the Venetian before watching the Blue Man Group, and so we stumbled upon this cute little restaurant in the middle of the Venetian Shops. I ordered the Beef Risotto and my boyfriend ordered the Cannelloni Di Pollo.   I expected a lot from my Beef Risotto since it was priced around $20 for a very small portion of food. The beef was probably the only highlight to the risotto. I did not like the wine sauce that it came with and the risotto tasted hard and not cooked thoroughly. I think I enjoyed eating my boyfriend's food more than my own. His order of the Cannelloni Di Pollo was overwhelmingly cheesy but the chicken and the marinara sauce was good.   The service here is the main reason why I give this place only two stars. It was really really pain stakingly SLOW (I even emphasized to our waiter that we had a show to catch!). We were in such a rush to catch our show and almost missed it because of how slow the service was. We waited 15 minutes for someone to bring us our bill and towards the end we just walked up to pay for the meal.  I probably won't come back to this place since there are so many better restaurants in Vegas. But I guess if you have all the time in the world and want to pay for overpriced risotto you can give this place a shot.

M5vHgFfFZpi3lFynJYSWtQ.text: Great service and food. We had gnocchi with marinara sauce, grilled sea bass, lemon custard dessert. All were pretty good. Bread and olive oil were excellent.

PIsW8IB5sdhWOFkAnt_E2g.text: Drinks were delicious and refreshing.. we tried the Makers Tea, Sicillian sunset, and Rye Smash. Pesto was amazing. And they paired it with pasta off the menu.
