4eetQDJqLtyCbDTMaaQnuA.text: We are currently just finishing up our supper here at Restaurant Canaletto at The Venetian and I half to say it has been an amazing dinner...!  The service is exceptional and the food is top notch, dare I say the BEST I've had in Vegas to date...  Please, if you are visiting The Venetian make it a point to stop and have dinner or appetizers...Very refreshing to have a professional restaurant experience.

IofoLhF8hl0z4XJFwW8r3w.text: I was stationed in Northern Italy for two years so I was looking forward to some authentic Northern Italian. Very disappointing. Food was just ok but not worth the high price. Pasta was over cooked and my appetizer was brought out the same time as my entree. Again just way overpriced for low quality.

VmVN4xZAK96-kUuUBei2UQ.text: Really good location in the square inside of the Venetian shops. Really friendly service. A little on the slower side but that is okay, because the seating on the 'patio' was great and enjoyable.  The bread before the meal was plentiful. I had the endive pear salad and it was fantastic. For $12 it was very small though...almost could have just been a starter.  I would go here again to just enjoy the enviroment and people watch.

5EL1RCJrDiYh3PidsfwOUg.text: It is rated a 3.5 and that is fair. Service was friendly, food was just OK. Nothing bad just mediocre in quality and taste. Atmosphere was great. Gelato in plaza a delicious treat.

ybWyRg5KKZhdPeA1kEEqbw.text: Disappointing. The ambiance sitting out on the piazza people watching was nice, but the food did not impress. The gnocchi was mushy. My date had a sausage pasta dish that he enjoyed, but wasn't impressed with his salad. Our water wasn't refilled once.

AVkIWSjZEeUsv6hfzvE0vA.text: I'm on the pursuit of happiness, and I know Everything that shine ain't always gonna be gold Hey, I'll be fine once I get it, I'll be good at...CANALETTO! - Kid Cudi (pursuit of happiness)  Located in what feels like the heart of the Venetian near the canals, the location could not be any better. We were seated on the outside part of the restaurant so we could watch the performances going on every 15 minutes or so it seemed like. In the middle of the meal there was a performance lady in one of the fake balcony's above the restaurant that started singing opera, which was kind of weird and oddly cool at the same time.   We started off with the 'tempura' vegetables and it was really good actually. Yes this place is italian so technically they are fried vegetables but it reminded me of vegetable tempura! Anyways, some good variety including eggplant, asparagus, and the best one of them all: the artichokes. I would've been happy with a full plate of these fried artichokes as they were super tasty and light. For the main course, I had the seafood pasta with tomato sauce. Wow the pasta was definitely al dente, it was really well done although the seafood components weren't special. I couldn't even tell if they were fresh seafood or not; I think the pasta stood out more than the seafood and that's not a good thing. Service could've been better as well, food took much longer than expected and drinks took a while.  Food: 3 stars --- Service: 3 stars --- Atmosphere: 4 stars --- Price(value): n/a

wXU0m8Gj8BJ5f9Ps1up_mg.text: I loved that it was indoor, but had an outdoor feel. This area is just breathtaking. Food was delicious. Service was great

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious food &amp; Amazing scenery. Its inside by the way...

BhWarrj3uYBD4mOrAL2CdA.text: The food was nothing too special, but I did enjoy quite handily the risotto dish I had. Thing that really made me like it was our server. Dude was tri-lingual, hilarious and clearly going to do well for himself. He knew his stuff, was attentive and paid attention.   We walked up for lunch. Was window shopping while waiting for my brothers to recover from the previous night. Kids need to learn how to handle themselves (har). So we sorta were there way longer than we should have been. Waiter didn't seem to mind.   Decent food, more apt to show off the location...it is in the middle of a big fake piazza of course. Good for if you have no plans and don't care. Get to it.

ZeUVTQDoREerZelWf5Zo5A.text: Overpriced under flavored food. Highly recommend going somewhere else to get decent Italian food. The service was ok but the food was definitely disappointing. We ordered the cannelloni, PETTO DI POLLO AL PEPERONCINO and a couple other dishes. For the price you pay you should walk out satisfied but this food truthfully sucked.

Q2Bpa8nKYe3TGok2DXogJQ.text: I came here to have some drinks and appetizers before starting our night in Vegas. The maitre d' greeted us and instantly and took us to a table. The view was beautiful from where we were sitting, it is a great mock up of St. Mark's Square in Venice. Such a great place to people watch too.   Service was great. From our server to the manager Stefano, everyone was very attentive and friendly.   I had a very nice and stiff Negroni to start and for food we started with the salumeria assortita, which was very good! We also had the beef carpaccio which was fresh I liked that it had capers, not a lot of places do that. My favorite thing was probably the Gorgonzola polenta with truffle oil and meatballs. So so so so good!!! Get this and you will not regret it!!!   Essentially we were there celebrating my sisters birthday for the weekend. Our server must have overheard us talking about it or perhaps when we cheersed our drink because at the end of our meal he brought over a tiramisu with a candle on it!  We were all trying to figure out who told the server that it was her birthday lol that was such a nice gesture and came to all of us as a surprise!  We had an excellent time here... I would love to check it out again for entrees next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the sky
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef carpaccio
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Gorgonzola polenta with meatballs - delicious

2p9S2il5C_3eI5-lhqHybg.text: Came here for their happy hour (4-6pm) - $7 appetizers, pizzas, cocktails and prosecco.   Happy hour is served only at the bar or high tops. Unfortunately, they work on a first-come-first-serve basis - the hostess just pointed over to the bar, which was all full. This left us standing around awkwardly trying to figure out which table was closest to being done, and then doing the super annoying hover. Except hovering doesn't work well when the only spaces are the ones by the "real" tables and are filled with waiters bringing food out. There has to be a better system than that. A group in front of us decided not to wait, leaving my group of 3 with a roughly 10 min wait.  Okay now the important part: the food.  We ordered...  Carpaccio with arugula and capers: this was really tasty. There were maybe 10 slices of beef. Very tasty. Worth $7. 5/5  Octopus with potato: octopus was very tender, very tasty and again, very much worth $7. 5/5  Calamari: served with both a marinara and aioli. The polenta it comes with is a bit tasteless. This one was not much to write home about. Tender, but the type of dish that can be found in many places. 4/5  Salsiccia (sp?) pizza: meh. 2.5/5  Rosso delizioso cocktail: rum-based and fruity - very good balance of alcohol and sweetness. But I'm someone who likes alcohol on the lighter side.   Overall: portions were much better than we had expected, and this amount (plus bread basket) was enough to fill up 3 people very comfortably. Came to $37 for 3 people making this a very affordable option in Vegas without resorting to fast food.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rosso delizioso cocktail, carpaccio, octopus and potato, calamari, salsiccia pizza

kHdmlwwQwmuKUrpKLTMt3w.text: Terrible. Horrendous.   My experience started off poorly. I was there for a work dinner. We were seated in the room upstairs, and it was overbooked. There was barely any room to move around, and seating was limited. Fine. Not necessarily the fault of the restaurant - could have been the organizers - that may have over invited guests.   The dinner started at 7:30. Our orders were taken by 8:15ish.  Our food didn't start coming out until 9:30. I mean really? It was a price fixed menu. The salad was already selected, and we only had a choice between 4 entrees. We were told by the waiter that we couldn't make any substitutions. During the long wait time, it was next to impossible to get an initial drink, let alone a refill.   One of my sons got the salmon, it lacked any salt whatsoever and was grossly over cooked. I opted for the veal. The portion was small, and it was impossible to cut and chew. Also flavorless. They tried to make it look fancy by putting a cold glob of mozzarella cheese, and a piece of eggplant on top - but it couldn't hide the mediocrity. My wife had the roasted chicken - extremely dry.   Thank god the meal was free. Had I paid for food this terrible, especially after waiting so long, I would have lost it.

JOakRG-CmYcsI9x46EWong.text: This was the last restaurant I ate at in Vegas and was not disappointed. I requested a table on the "patio" and my request was honored. Although there are shops and tour groups walking around sometimes, it was a nice atmosphere pretending to be outside in Venice. The nearby singers are a nice touch.  I ordered the gnocchi bolognese which was freshly made and very filling. It was unfortunate my vegas hotel did not have a microwave. My wine was very good as well.  Attentive servers made for a good experience.

ODIj_CwsYhbA7B4zlacrOQ.text: Went here for a business dinner last night and the food was fine, nothing unbelievable. I do not recommend going here if you want to have a conversation with anyone. The waiter kept interrupting us mid-conversation to talk about nonsense. The live music in the canal shoppes was the worst music I think I've ever heard in my life. SCREECHING violins and flutes. Ridiculously loud. It was god awful.

7eZi9WMAvVwHaUTjHtxSqQ.text: If I could give zero stars, I would. Worst service I've had in 42 years. Waitress Alissa K (38129), was the most inattentive server. Failed to ask us if we wanted drinks, took our order and literally never checked on us again. When she brought the bill she didn't ask us if we wanted dessert or anything else, never filled our waters, and when I asked for a box to go she said she would get it and never returned. Another server took my food and actually boxed it up for me. The food was good, but for zero service from the staff we will never go back. Avoid this place at all costs unless you want to sit and wait for just about nothing. If you're going to have garbage service, at least have amazing food to balance it out. Never again Canaletto...never again!!!

hrZetXMD9NCR35RMRFWs5g.text: Like most other things in Las Vegas, this is more of a show business rather than a restaurant. The service is very good. The ambiance is cute to pretend you are somewhere in Italy. However the food is very basic. Nothing special about the pastas. It is over priced for that quality of food.

I1GDPbxVDfZywveGgi6KUQ.text: We arrived at the Venetian on a Thursday and so dining at Canaletto was an easy choice. The location is beautiful, right in the center of their St. Marks square. It does get crowded at times.  Service was good.  Appetizers  Octopus salad Ravioli with cream sauce  Entrees Grilled salmon  Risotto with seafood Veal scallopine Giant prawns  Dessert  Zabaione Food was very good and prices where reasonable considering you are inside the Venetian.  Would definitely dine here again when in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zabaione
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled salmon

49jLocf-_ITAo3J56uefog.text: Nice restaurant. It's pricey. Def not cheap. Food was very tasty. The server was pleasant. Wine was great though it could have been decanted because there was sediment in it for one of the glasses at my party's table. I would give it five stars but it didn't blow me away. It was ok, not great but not terrible either. Typical Italian place that does its job but just too pricey for me. It is Vegas thought so that's to be expected.

XR8tdpDnEpGBuFsA5TP6xQ.text: Very good restaurant inside the grand canal shopper, I ordered pizza and gelato, the taste was super, service was just fine, staffs are friendly and helpful

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JShZTLsMciqBq0a4rcp3Qg.text: So I was lucky enough to be able to accompany my friend to a private dinner here. And the menu was pre-fixe, except you could choose what your entree was and one of two desserts. The menu was as follows: -Insalata Di Pere: Arugula, radicchio, frisee, Belgian endive, grilled pears, grapes, blue cheese, toasted pecans, pomegranate dressing (delicious) -Risotto Sant Erasmo: Risotto of fresh shrimp and baby artichoke (this should have been my most favorite dish out of anything we were served, but the rice was about 2 minutes away from being done [tough interior] and the shrimp were those mealy little things that are not good for anything aside from pureeing into a paste) -My entree choice was Pesce Speciale Del Giorno: (fresh fish of the day which was Sea Bass) served with roasted potatoes and sauteed vegetables. (this was delicious and prepared extremely well, if not a bit boring) -Sgroppino lemon sorbet, prosecco, vodka and cream (a delicious little drink) -My dessert choice was the Cannoli Siciliani: cannoli filled with sheep's milk ricotta, candied orange, bittersweet chocolate and pistachio. (while I appreciated the detail by which they did not pre-fill the shells so they stayed crisp, the filling was unfortunate. Thick, dry, and with far too much orange peel.  Basically, this was a so-so meal that was made better by the fact that I didn't have to pay for it, haha. It really was more like dining at an upscale wedding, everything just OK, but on the extremely unadventurous side to please multiple palates. Hopefully their regular menu is better, seems like it might be based on the pictures posted here.

U7zLLgQt4XiqPrzckGvQIw.text: Very poor experience. Reserved a table with confirmed patio seating at 5PM for the same night. On arrival, I was made to wait more than 30 mins for a table outside. Even then wasn't given one. Check in staff lied saying a table will be free soon. Highly recommend skipping and trying another place.

IF47Eeqb7_qZbpQNAh_FZg.text: After having been in Rome, Italy and having the best pizza ever my husband and I have been trying to find something close and authentic! Fast forward we have found a spot! Jackpot baby!! This pizza was soooo good that I felt an urge to hug the chef! It was so juicy and the crusty was perfect!

TojIlB4fruhu79ocxBTEig.text: If I can give a ZERO it will be a 0! Good was worse than anyone without cooking skills can cook - the beef liver was over cooked and was disgusting to look at and eat, the polenta was burned on the bbq and the salmon that we ordered came with uncooked vegetables! Staff was nothing compared to the restaurant across the "square"!

ARsCD63a8fxbGoVSqlsSFw.text: Had a great dinner at this spot. It's perfect for a relaxing night away from the hustle and the bustle of the strip - plus you get the outside patio feel without the intense summer heat of Vegas.  Our waiter was very kind and informative. I had the gnocchi bolognese and it was delicious. You could tell the gnocchi was fresh and the portion was perfect - I didn't feel overwhelmed like you sometimes can from eating gnocchi.  We had a bottle of wine and they didn't mind us just sitting there to finish it up. We definitely had a very long dinner without feeling rushed, which is always appreciated.

ftfBBZ-nSVDWgLwbSPG4dg.text: Amazing experience here. Natasha our event planner was outstanding - from A to Z, no request was too big, she accommodated us with everything and we felt like superstars - we did a champagne and cake toast with food there and we were looked after so well and the food, ambience, service and amenities were amazing. Thank you Natasha and team, unforgettable!!!

u3NmjXrsMmi19B1v0T7WEw.text: It's so authentic that it is a tourist trap. Service really sucks. Food was decent though. You pay for the Faux Venizia! My wine was good and the. Piazza entertainment was nice. I had the fish stew and it was fresh and good. My partner had the Pennoli Ragu which was excellent.

dVHqO7gyivN0Nm7vBa3boQ.text: Fuck this place.... waiter doesnt even come by turns out he was speaking to people behind us for 15 minutes while not serving us.... then has the nerve to come by and ask if we're ready or need more time.... we ordered food and drinks on fear we may not be served again.... aaaaaannnnnddddd I was right.... we ordered soda and that didn't even come out .... so we left... turns out he was talking to the Italians again in native tongue.... guess I was from the wrong country  Pic of the waiter cuz he poised me off and idgaf at this point

N05yM9e4MxuLQrRbNEK9gg.text: I was going to a show at the Venetian and wanted to try some place different and Canaletto came to mind.  I made a reservation for 5:15 and was seated promptly when I arrived at a two top table on the patio where I had a good view of the Venetian's "street performers" and the tourists walking by.  I was quickly brought a nice bread basket--more than enough for one person--and the server asked if I wanted balsamic and olive oil.  Declining the balsamic, I went with the olive oil and put some salt in it for the extra flavor I like.  I asked about the soup of the day and it was broccolini and that sounded good so I ordered that.  For the main course, I got their three pasta dish with pennoni al ragu, house-made ravioli filled with roasted pear, and pesto gnocchi.  My two favorites were the tubes topped with ragu sauce and the ravioli.  There was a bit of tomato/water mixture from not draining completely but I was surprised how much I liked the traditional meat ragu.  The ravioli were very good, also, and they had a very nice flavor given the pear filling, something I wouldn't expect in pasta.  The gnocchi were the least favorite of the trio.  They were heavier than I like them and the pesto sauce was lacking.  For dessert, I got a wonderful lime tart that had a tasty cookie crumb base.  These are Strip prices but not as bad as one sees some places.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lime custard.
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta trio.
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Broccolini soup.

ao-Mr-O1Kw349Ig4-hgxcg.text: Bad experience started on entering the Venetian and extended throughout the meal.  Meal first. Rude tourist "cattle car" service from hostess through staff and management. Mediocre food at more than mediocre prices.   All the people movers to access the property are broken and in one case one direction is blocked.  This does not go down well with the well oiled members of the tourist hordes; lots of negative interpersonal action.  One of the interior hallways  is also under construction leading to a similar dynamic  If you want the indoor square atmosphere with good service you might want to consider spago a food the street at Caesars   Even better food wise  and service wise are dcog and Scarpetta in the cosmopolitan.

d7sqG--DzhQLZqEaugcSug.text: Excellent service but food was terrible.  My husband ordered rib eye the taste was way off.  I know they are proud of aged beef but this tasted rancid.  I had gnocchi very very under seasoned and very small portion.

5a8aONK8N0L8wIlzxmRTzQ.text: I had late lunch at Canaletto, specifically to taste their seppie nere risotto. I've had this dish on my to-taste list for a while and found it on their menu via their website. The risotto was excellent. The squid ink has a delicate, subtle flavor that complimented the seafood in the risotto. It paired well with a glass of chardonnay. Just an additional post about squid ink. I found this interesting and informative: gourmet.com/food/2009/02...

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. seppie nere at Canaletto

Ffru7Rfl7GQBV0UktP_mQQ.text: We decided to eat here for our formal Bachelorette party dinner as 1) they're not strict on seating - the entire party does not have to all be there to get seated 2) they can hold large parties and 3) prices were reasonable and 4) the menu has a wide-selection of offerings to satisfy every palate.  Three of us decided to share our dishes so that we can get a taste of everything that sounded good so we skipped out on ordering appetizers.  { ORDER } * Risotto Con Secoe e Funghi - risotto with beef tenderloin and mushrooms in a white wine sauce (it was a bit salty) ** Linguine Alla Buranella - linguini with seafood in a red tomato sauce - yummy! ** Tagliatelle Alla Castellana - Fettuccine pasta tossed with pork, bacon, shitake mushrooms in a white cream sauce - a great selection as well!  { ENVIRONMENT } I think sitting outside in the patio is better since you have a view of the canal as well as the beautiful "sky".  We sat inside as they didn't have any large tables in the patio area.  { TIP } For large parties, always book at least 1 week in advance. The restroom is upstairs.  If your heels can't take the stairs, they have an elevator.  The portions here are a lot bigger than Mario Batali's and you can't really go wrong with an Il Fornaio-restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tagliatelle Alla Castellana (pasta ribbons with pork, bacon, shiitake mushrooms in a creamy sauce)
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine Alla Buranella (linguine with seafood)

oJ9w-SegUy4JQD1gibnOug.text: Hmmm - while a fan of the Mothership (Il Fornaio), this paled in comparison. It was fine, but overpriced and not nearly as good as I was hoping for. The spot is convenient if staying at The Venetian or Palazzo, but also convenient if you want to see the canal area there. I made a reservation on Open Table and had a nice hightop table awaiting me upon arrival. My sever was attentive and brought True Italian style to his work (calling me "Bella" and using other Italian phrases). They provided bread and olive oil with balsamic on the table, but the bread felt and tasted old. I started with a cypress salad and it was just OK. I then opted for the four cheese gnocchi at the waiter's suggestion, and while they did melt in my mouth, I wasn't thrilled with the green bean bits throughout the sauce. I finished with the cannoli - I have had better, and it was four mini ones versus a big one. All in all, three star meal.

bmpKN8bX5vrX9JwcaDppDg.text: Service was good and the food was good (not excellent, but good).  Ambiance wasn't quite as romantic as I'd hoped from looking at it online, but once they dimmed the lighting, it was better.  I'd thought that there was a small section that was next to the canal where you could watch the gondolas, but there is not; it's all in the middle of St. Mark's Square, so not super intimate (we never went inside). They were very thoughtful to bring a birthday tiramisu. Overall, we'd recommend it, and for Venetian restaurants, it's one of the better value places.

MIBh5PPn3cObVfnbmQs5JA.text: We absolutely loved this restaurant. I would try to get a reservation. We had the giant prawns pasta. It was so amazing!  The atmosphere in the middle of St Marks square was so perfect. The portion sizes were adequate. I would encourage you to share because then you get to try more meals. I will be back to this place next time I'm in Vegas.

NdrYsclhYsTdNWXel6krgg.text: Food was very good and they were accommodating with changes to the menu. The patio seating was fun because you can watch people go by. Try the smoked swordfish....it was great

ooqJstgPPoW8pOgGrAQHRg.text: The best food I had in Vegas. I had a gluten free pasta dish with goat cheese and it was incredible. Beautiful view of the street performers and delicious food and cocktails.

EBxVD5JHPqC_VJBdisNGJQ.text: I've eaten at Canaletto's on a couple of different occasions now so I have mixed reviews.    Group dinning~ is 4 stars if you have a group and reserve their private dinning area.  For larger groups they will arrange a specific dinning menu for you if you desire one.  They do a nice job catering to groups in their private dinning area which is nice and cozy for small to medium sized groups of people.  Their food is usually very good and they have a great wine selection.   Regular Dinning~ is 2 stars due to the service you get and the quality of the dinning experience does not hit the mark for what you are expecting.  Our food comes out at varying temps, so we had to send something back twice.  The pasta's dishes are very good but we had their marghetta pizza and their salamone alla griglia.  The pizza was not to temp so we wound up eating the salmone dish first then finishing the pizza later. Our server did not try to make amends with their error.    Me to you ~ this is a very good place to dine if you have a small group and are looking for a place that is cozy and won't cost an arm and leg.  If you're dinning for two, you may consider trying this place or going somewhere else.

JowAkqL-xgrB3KMkyb3D_w.text: I really enjoy this restaurant and one of my favorites in Vegas. We have held small events upstairs for work, dined for lunch and small groups for dinner. I have never had s bad meal here. The service is awesome for the events we have had. My favorite meal is rigatoni with meat sauce. Simple with lots of flavor. I have Lao tried their Caesar salad which is what you would expect. The bread they bring is really good too. Overall I continue come each time when I can!

YsqWQhqOBGOkn4uggUXKwQ.text: Good food, ok service. Nice spot for tourists with open air entertainers but not conducive for business meeting unless seated inside.

0Xbr5OJpZI1EShApreXd3A.text: Extremely good pizza, with very tasty cheese and super thin crust goodness. I just has the margarita pizza with a salad, and they offered Parmesan cheese. When I said yes the dude came back with a block of Parmesan and shredded some on our pizza and salad, so good. So, I suggest this place if you feel like Italian, no wait on a Saturday night and decent prices.

6syWFqgWJW5VOsIWIf2CLQ.text: What a great spot to hit up for lunch if you are near or at The Venetian or Palazzo. You can may choose to sit in the exterior atrium (and stare at the fun faux-clouds) area or in the more intimate interior section. The views of of the Grand Canal and gondolas passing are quite relaxing especially when you may have had your fill on the over-the-top excess of Vegas.  We had a party of 9 without reservations, yet they efficiently seated us at a nice table in the interior area. Service was good and the server was very helpful with making suggestions for my vegan diet too. Wine by the glass is affordable. I ordered up a tasty Chianti for around $11 to pair with my salad which was the Insalata Di Pere ($10.99) that was comprised of arugula,, radicchio, frisee, grilled pears, grapes, Belgian endive, toasted pecans, and crumbled blue cheese which I excluded. It was a fantastic start to my meal. The fresh array of breads was replenished throughout the meal can be a danger zone as you can fill up pretty quickly if you're not careful....  My main course was the Barilotti Integrali Al Forno and did not disappoint with whole wheat barrel-shaped pasta,chopped eggplant, garlic, peperoncino, tomato sauce and fresh basil. With my vegan diet, I excluded the smoked mozzarella but with all the other fresh flavors, I didn't miss the cheese at all!  What a solid meal. Cheers!

zO6Ywy0z8JPRJbn_riazPw.text: There is definitely no shortage of Italian restaurants in Vegas and  I can't exactly compare my experience at Canaletto to other places due to this being only my second trip to Sin City.  What I can say however, is that they provide a solid experience both in service and in the actual meal.  We went ahead and reserved a seat on Open Table, but in retrospect it does not seem necessary.  While busy, there did not appear to be a wait (6 PM.).  I guess I'm easily impressed because my waiter could pronounce everything on the menu.  This may not seem like some great feat, but my Indian father and I were butchering the menu like nobody's business.  I was equally as impressed by the prompt service and courteousness of every member of the staff.   Now on to the food.  My father got what was essentially a fish stew and he was very pleased.  It was definitely a seafood smorgasbord.  From prawns to shrimp to clams, there was definitely nothing left to want.  I had already partaken in a monster meal at Carnegie deli earlier that day, so I was not interested in one of the heavier meals.  I chose the vermicelli al pomodoro and it was exactly the light meal I was looking for.  The pasta was tossed in a light tomato and olive oil sauce that was very tasty while not being overbearing.    As I mentioned earlier and other reviewers have said, there is a plethora of Italian food in Las Vegas; specifically in the Shops at the Venetian.  With my limited knowledge, I wholeheartedly recommend Canaletto.

SX7jR-Qxsr_OS7klHLIDRw.text: Never never had a bad meal here year after year. Wait staff excellent and food not too shabby either.

AkotHpNho0oWTmIXcp6ufw.text: Decent restaurant as we went here as it had plenty of tables to eat at and we all liked Italian food.  The food was good but not great.  The service is okay as this place is a big production restaurant so there are lots of waiters running around.  My veal was a little tough and lacked flavor.  The calamari appetizer was good but typical.  With tip, our meal ran $300 for two pasta dishes, one veal, one calamari and two bottles of wine.  I probably won't be back as there are lots of interesting places nearby.

GA715q5CCXtACJaE1Sw50g.text: I went here for a team event and had a private room. The service was good. The view and ambiance were awesome. There is an upstairs and downstairs. The setup was really nice. We had a few appetizers that were really good. Had a filet mignon with roasted potatoes and broccoli and it was really good and flavorful! The drinks were strong which was my favorite part lol! We didn't have access to the full menu but I enjoyed everything we tried and the service as well. Will be back to try more.

bURaCo-q20AnkzVM6nQBYA.text: Great atmosphere. Had the chicken... forgot what it was but it came with spinach. Worse chicken plate for 28$ that I ever had. Sheesh for 28$ i was hoping for more garnish and not so cheap spinach. Sorry but I rather eat at Olive Garden. Very tasteless. Was very disappointing. Would not recommend nor will i revisit this place any time soon again. Waiter was not as attentive either. Still gave him a 9$ tip for a 28$ dollar for a cheap meal.

5OdM91s5OW-LVDsjs6z3FA.text: Just plain good Italian food. Little bit Americanized. You can still get a ceasar salad as well as a descent caprese. They were accommodating for a baby and a time crunch! We got three salads and the classic pizza. They were accompanied by the bread and balsamic as well. A step up from the food court and not too fancy.

0_8vPHmOn7r0_in9dejwTw.text: The prosciutto was good but the food was mediocre. The view was cute and the inside wasn't overcrowded.

k0HhU7IW4TdxsbSjaQo72g.text: Ah -- Canaletto is in Venice.The Las Vegas one and it's a good place to go.Your on a square outside and performances break out.I had fun. There's even gondoliers around and a canal.Actually the "real" Venice is much weirder( Don't Look Now- doesn't strike me as that off).But that's ok .The food is pretty good and the service pleasant.I had Branzino filet and wife had Salmon.It was one of the few times on the trip I sprung for a bottle of wine- overpriced Princepessa Gavi.We followed with desert and expresso.Main courses are served with vegetables and potatoes.One big plus is you are not blasted by overamplified, wretched pop music of the young woman screams and ululates about how much she's in love and  castrati  do likewise type.Las Vegas is too noisy !This was nice.

Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Canaletto

6aWp3au6Ww5IotgE0GflQQ.text: I had a very good experience here for lunch. I ordered a linguine seafood dish that came in a red sauce with clams, scallops, shrimp and mussels. It was really tasty and the portion size was nice. For dessert, I ordered the line tart. This felt like it was pre-made, and it could have used more of a zesty lime flavor since it was a bit on the bland side. Overall, a very decent meal with a good wait staff.

j-thdNqDwLmROaoXxEqTwg.text: It is truly a sin to call this Italian food. With all the good dining options in Vegas my only excuse for ending up here was sheer exhaustion from traveling and not doing my homework before we set out for dinner.   To go with the bread, the waiter poured out olive oil onto a plate. And out came a small insect onto the plate. He apologized profusely and frankly I was too tired to care and he got us new olive oil. It went downhill from there. I ordered cannelloni and it was the worst I've ever had. I was very hungry and could only eat about a quarter if it. The risotto also has a bad flavor and was hardly edible.   The good news is that every meal we had in Vegas after this one was delicious. Since it was our first meal in town, Canaletto could not have set the bar any lower.

LEJxIDXaGQDVOpVRg74xHQ.text: Kinda over priced for what we got.    The food wasn't bad at all.  Service........a bit slow.  We paid $50 per head for a set menu.  I ordered the   SALMONE ALLA GRIGLIA - chinook salmon fillet grilled with lemon-oil and parsley sauce; served with roasted yukon gold potatoes and sauteed seasonal vegetables.  With our meal came the bread, salad and tiramisu for dessert  Salmon was tasty, potatoes were cooked to perfection and seasoned well... I just didn't think it was worth $50... especially when the service was slow.  We had one server for our party of 20...... We had a private room for our party.......it was nice and intimate.  The server did everything, but it seemed like he really wasn't there.  They should have had an extra server so they could cater to us...... oh well.   If you don't mind the price, its worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmone Alla Griglia

yBZogxJfeAK7LKgiX1g_Jg.text: Pro: great view from second floor; clean establishment including bathroom.  Cons: poor staffing: for a group of fourteen (reserved in advanced with a menu of pre-selected items) we had only had one waiter.  It looked like our waiter also had another big group of people by himself. Service took forever. Waiter was nice enough, but appears to be set up to fail by management.   Food: underwhelming. Costata di Manzo alla Griglia - ordered steak as medium rare, but arrived over cooked and tasted like rubber.  Vegetarian entree - Casonzei con Stracchino  e Perre tasted exactly like the Pennette all Vodka that was served first. Salmone Alla Griglia was the only palatable entree.   Food appeared to be cooked hours in advance. All entrees received were barely warm. The bread was delish! So no surprise there considering this place is owned by Il Fornaio. That being said, I've eaten at Il Fornaio in Southern California in Pasadena and Irvine, but the entrees were much much better at these locations. I agree with other sentiments posted here - tourist trap with no incentive to change the quality of their food and/or behavior.

vlz_7woFpowusDBZRoGblA.text: Excellent dinner! Authentic Italian. Great service. Fish soup and grilled salmon both excellent. Highly recommend.

7kNP6NcrZ25NIlbJJFt2Ow.text: The outside seating provides a great atmosphere but then real star is the service. Top notch, polite and attentive. The food was decent.  I had a grilled salmon from the lunch special...nothing special.  Wish they would have pan-seared the fish.  Wife loved the minestrone soup.  Her steak was decent, again nothing mind blowing.  Overall a great experience.

WnEzXngiHXbGiTvg-Cf2nQ.text: I really liked the location and atmosphere of this restaurant!   They have A LOT of seating available.   This place is located in the beautiful Grand Canal Shoppes ...  and there is also a free stage show,  that I randomly passed by.  People were dressed in costumes like from the Renaissance!   After a few hours of shopping and walking,  I thought this would be a great place to take a break and eat.  I got the impression that the hostess was new because after she seated me at my table,  I had to move!?!  Then a few minutes later,  a couple nearby ended up moving to a different table too.  The time was afternoon,  so lunch rush was over and dinner hadn't started yet,  but it was still busy.  I definitely wanted a drink,  so ended up at the bar and changed my mind not to order food.   They seemed disorganized and I didn't have a comfortable feeling, thinking a one hour lunch might turn into 2 hours lunch ... Whilst I still had a lot of plans for later.  Drinks were very expensive, but that's okay,  I was on vacation and only care to enjoy my time and new experience.   I got two bartenders,  one was friendly and cool, the other was a jerk!!  I guess he was having a bad day and got impatient when I couldn't decide on my drink choice.  Plus he made my drink wrong, he forgot to put the fresh Strawberries!!!  I didn't say anything because it tasted great and it had a good amount of alcohol.   So, when the nice bartender came over,  I ordered dessert.   It was a lovely dessert with a Bellini sorbet, blackberries, baicoli cookies, and cream, very delicious.   I'm glad I did not order food,  since how my first experience started off there with the hostess and server.  I paid and left a big tip, hopefully both bartenders shared it but who knows ?  I was happy and enjoying my day, can't help it when others are negative,  maybe the extra tip % cheered up the moody bartender ;)   I love the Venetian and Grand Canal Shoppes,  I practically came here almost every day of my week vacation in Vegas!   Hopefully next time I can actually get nice service and a great meal.

Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zabaione Alla Gritti
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0Yb0vEQ18Qe6Yu36xuwXnw.text: Located inside the Venetian in St. Marks square. Average at best. Limited vegetarian options, bland tasting as well. Good wine. Had to ask for necessities - napkins, olive oils, crushed pepper, Parmesan several times. No reason to go back when I'm in Vegas.

BtocSMqpxaNnUbA1n8hgOA.text: Good food. Prices are high, but what do you expect at the Venetian. Nice to have live entertainment during dinner. Service was good. Would come back again, if the strip was not such a nightmare. One of the few casinos left with free parking though, which is a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_NvQ-6Oo_xa7sB1O3_zNvg.text: My family is always come to this  amazing Italian restaurant to have diner.  An amazing fresh Italian dishes and very delicious! Love this place. Also beautiful!

SrnwkFovxj8-RiXSUgoiLA.text: Great service let me start off by saying their salter caramel gelato is to die for ! So delicious!! We had a party of four our food all came out at the same time everyone loved what they got. I had a chicken dish that was extremely tasty and just full of flavor! My husband got a chicken pasta dish it was good but not over the top. There was also a salmon dish and a seafood plate that from the looks of it was really good. Great place to eat at the Venetian and very reasonable prices for being in the Venetian .

rSGmVYWigPu3zob3Z26iAg.text: In town for a conference and had dinner here...  Great service and loved the location.  Great food and drinks as well.

BLaANDqN5Cn_2XsRkbDjEA.text: Underwhelming! Love the look of the place but food and service were very lacking. Waiter messed up 3 orders for a party of 6. Very un apologetic. Veal scalopini with mushrooms was bland, reminded me of some thing I would get at a large hotel banquet type of setting. Will not head back any time soon.

OXk5eojXys1ntcTuvi1JLA.text: Came here for my second year anniversary and it was a complete disaster! I got married in vegas and had my reception at this place. I thought my husband and I could start a tradition by coming back to this place yearly on our anniversary, I was WRONG. My meal was so salty and was I co planned about it...and about 20 mins later, I got some pasta with oysters... well more like SHELLS! two of my oysters shells were completely empty! I LOST MY APPETITE after this. So I go to the restroom and it smells of complete marijuana! I got to the next stall.... blood all over the toilet seat! So I was forced to inhale the polluted air and in doing so I vomited the little food that I DID eat! I come back to a $250 dollar bill with BOTH of my returned meals on it! I was furious! Especially after vomiting the little food I did eat. This place literally made me sick! When I informed someone of the mess and smell in the restroom... they responded with "okay" and just gave me a dead stare.  I feel horrible for the lovely wife that was having her reception there that night. I honestly would like my time and money back! I'll never come back here again... sorry to say.

gaa_kUqlaSOzMzWTTJWDTg.text: Great location inside the Venetian with nice "outdoor" seating. Shrimp risotto was fairly good.

ZR5pONyJk-bdzV_mbl3T7g.text: THIS PLACE IS A SCAM!!!!  I hope that the owner of this place take the necessary action against the manager in charge on 5/8/16 for overcharging me and refusing to adjust there won mistake.  So we ordered pasta and a bottle of wine. The food was average. But when we got the bill, we were charged the wrong price so we asked to adjust it. And the so cold manager refused to fix the mistake. Scam! Not good. I would never recommend this scam to anyone.

SvaRLb4xRo1H62CnBFlB3Q.text: Just love this place, ate here 3 times this week. The food was amazing, the service was even more amazing ! The bartender Marco deserves an award!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cristina pizza

MRC4uIGVDLo0BJRKAibpxQ.text: Canaletto brings a very nice ambiance to dinner time. We arrived here with reservations with my party of 4 which they seated us immediately. We ordered their formaggi misti in which the waiter did not stop to appropriately go through what kind of cheese it had. This was a bit of a disappointment. As the evening progressed we ordered one of their Pinot Grigio from Ca which was delicious. We also ordered their Bruschetta which was not bad as well. Despite it being busy the waiter was kind enough to come check in on us. The Risotto was probably one of their best dishes and I do recommend starting there.   If you are looking for a pretty restaurant to dine in at the Venetian this is your spot. The location is probably one of the best in St. Marks Square and I honestly can't say it offers much else and their food is average.

g3wTdwXgkIqOpI1C8k0D4Q.text: Very nice Italian dinner with the parents. Service was great and prices weren't too bad considering the quality of the food. I recommend the taglitelle al gorgonzola. Creamy yumminess but not too overpowering (don't really like it when it's TOO creamy). The shiitake mushrooms are an interesting addition, but enjoyed it. If you're around the Venetian and want a quaint date, I think this is a good spot.

TnFWa99dD71PhZtsEDCjXA.text: Awesome place! Excellent food, great service and a nice atmosphere. Next time I'm in vegas I will be back!

YGg-7qFgPvjUsn5ueV2EFg.text: Had dinner at this place for my Bday this past Monday.  I Give em 4 stars because of the outdoor seating alongside St Marks Square and because of my girlfriend being the one I was having dinner with. Of course all the time I am with her it's an experience of 10 stars.   Anyway this place was more like 3 stars, was expecting more. Maybe it was the weird plastic chairs or the food that just came out a little too quick. Hmmmm..... The pizza we had that came topped with Asparagus n Artichokes was average to say the least. The Castellagna pasta dish was a lil better than the pizza. But the star of the show had to be the salmon dish my chick ordered. Now that was a tasty piece of fish! Couple glasses of white wine which washed away of the taste of my mouth of a 20 dollar pasta dish that I think I could have made much better.   It is Vegas after all, lots of foreigners so they must cater to them cause thats who we had sitting around us. At least the service was pretty good, that maybe was the best of the dining experience. Oops! Forgot best part of the dining experience was the beautiful sexy woman sitting across from me.

S6xxHN0z4gDOnK2wSXfahA.text: The host was really rude - we asked to sit at an empty table closer to the "square" and he just basically said no as he was walking away.  There was no reservation for the table and it was not too big for our party (perhaps by 1 chair for a party of 6).  The service was pretty slow I know someone else said the bread was great but I thought it was only so so, they should really just leave the OO and Balsamic vinegar at the table The atmosphere is great which is why people go, and I was surprisingly impressed by the food.  I had the special white tuna for the day and it was flavorful at the perfect consistency

myuFzS0yCmZRvZMXoloNJQ.text: Sitting "outside" in the courtyard, drinking in the soothing operatic sounds of the entertainers and enjoying fine italian wine...no better way to end our time in Vegas.  Then our server Christopher walks up and we remember we are in the middle of the desert, and Christopher is clearly pissed about being stuck in Venice.  The food, the atmosphere, the time spent at the table was great...our service sucked.  If you can look past the possibility of cranky pants not refilling your coffee for an hour then you can have a great time.    I had the Osso Bucco, and it was outstanding.

TIyqAS8eTbq54883h4RPKg.text: Torn between two and three stars, but I'll go with three stars.  The food was fine but not great, and given all of the great places to eat in Vegas...  I was with a large bachelorette party, so they were able to take all of us (which is huge) and we had a private room.  We had a pre-set menu, so we had a limited selection.  I found my salmon to be a little overdone, but considering that they had to get 25 meals out at the same time, they did a pretty decent job.  Canaletto is a great place for a large party.  There is a big bar upstairs that is a great place to have pre-dinner cocktails and a few private rooms for dining.

VLXGwB9HGz6ejAAKK1dwgg.text: Some might find the loud opera like shows in the faux-Italian square outside the restaurant "charming". I found it annoying to have to yell to talk to my friends at lunch over the stupid show going on right beside the restaurant.   Service was SLOW  Bread basket was off the hook (yes, I'm easily impressed). I got the pizza christina. The ingredient mixture was killer - proscuitto, a special italian cheese,mushrooms, white truffle oil. Perfection I tell you. The crust was pretty generic, however. It was that thin crust that every "authentic" Italian place has. That ingredient combo on a Settebello pizza would be so killer!

31qKBMxOBw51eRLkE-VrPg.text: I liked the food and the service! We picked seafood sampler for appetizers and we liked it a lot and as for the main course we had couple of pasta dishes and they were pretty tasty. I also love the ambience right in the middle of Venetian. The wine recommendation was really good.

eZ296fELnM6OpH5C_5ElLQ.text: Not the top Italian restaurant in town but a great spot for a lighter style of Italian if you don't want too much. Also a great spot for lunch especially with larger groups. Service was not too bad. Has a great location though in the Venetian.

Ht8MiPLcLcHOHl9Ea1CthA.text: I was really looking forwarded to this meal and was expecting a 4 star dinner. The restaurant is clean and it is right off of the canal. I had the ravioli while my husband had the brazino. The food was good - worthy of at least 3.5 stars but the service was horrible. We asked our waiter to recommend a white wine. He mumbled a few things and then brought us a tasting on a white wine. It was nice so he filled our glasses. He never asked if we wanted just a glass or a bottle. Midway through the meal, our glasses were empty but no one ever asked us if we wanted another glass of wine. For the price, I expect way better service. With all of the restaurants in Las Vegas, there are way better options than this.

qnHGOk-5AScIU__HLA1Tww.text: Just finished sitting at Canaletto Ristorante, the food was subpar, the pizza they call Margherita pizza was just a tired old cheese pizza and the waitress took it upon herself to not add the basil because I had kids with me instead of asking me if I wanted basil which we did, I tried ordering something else off the menu and they took forever to bring it so I have to cancel the order while the kids got to eat the regular cheese pizza they call Margherita pizza we had asked for the check to go to somewhere else to eat, not even the manager came out to ask if everything was okay they just gave me the check that was it....

hRvTYpQRm5yczHYmKSo50w.text: Nice place , pleasant environment, good quality food and good wine selection. Descent pricing , good service . Dined with my friend , had fun ,  waiters were attentive and very friendly. Would go again

C2-1GP42gp-Ijc3sX7Zj9Q.text: The staff make this place fe very Italian, but the food and drinks fail miserably. I could not taste any alcohol in my Baileys and coffee. Our deserts were not that great either, Apple Crepes that were cold and tiramisu that was thin and dry.

RjRBG5xdAOwZyOi0HH3_eQ.text: Place is nice. Food is good. Ordered the roasted half chicken. It was superb.  It had a crunchy skin and was well spiced. Bartender was a good wine selector. Service was well oriented. 4 stars due to a higher price.

WNd2HrxZfq-bud7oeZ0BXw.text: Service: FANTSTIC! Servers were very informative, friendly and courteous. Never had any issues with them what so ever. Maybe they heard the other yelpers? =)  Food: The sample bread was great we had another basket after our first. All our food was hot, fresh and tasty. Sauces were ample and fresh. Pasta was cooked just right and it was delicious. Seasoning was just right, little on the plain side for some folks but I like it that way and of course, it's always better than TOO salty.  Wine: They had our usual Port which is Fonseca Bin 27. I strongly recommend it after pasta =)  Atmosphere: Great! had holiday music and ton of ppl. Loved it. I did find it a bit strange to hear the musicians play Chinese National Anthem TWICE to please large crowd of Chinese tourist.No offense but I Had mad urge to request God Bless America and Star Spangled Banner 10 times. Should've seen them... crazy clapping and everything yo  -  _____ -  Location: It can't be beat. We went 3 times during our stay for dinner and lunch after shopping and walking all day.  Overall 5 star! I shall be Back

lptDx2-ev19PfNoV2Za5Tg.text: Went in on a Saturday night with no reservations. Got seated right away inside, table for four. Great service from Josh and Luis. I had the ribeye, just a little bit over charred on one side but otherwise very good food. The waiter recommended a bottle of wine that was featured for $39, sorry don't remember the name but it too was very good. Would go back for sure.

m8nfp7gFP4ijnFt_DEDAcg.text: Service was very good with freindly and attentive waitress.  However the food was mediocre at best.  I ordered the grilled salmon whichvwas not very flavorful and was dry.  For the money you could do much better.  This seems to draw the tourist crowd as you can sit ouside and watch the shows in the courtyard.

Y7J-1U1EZWnj3fg5REcMSw.text: We had originally wanted to go to Bouchon but since it was a two hour wait we walked around the Venetian and found Canaletto.  Having walked by here numerous times and having never been here I was happy to give this place a chance since it meant I have a new place to yelp about.  To start off with the waiter was rather weird.  He was snobbish, walked around like he had something better to do, and acted like our questions were a waste of his time.  Well anyway that's how the gf and I felt but since we didn't want any extra surprises in our food we just let it go.    The table ordered a variety of pastas and gf and I ordered squid ink risotto, bruschetta, and calamari to share.  The latter was original, nothing bad and nothing great.  The bruschetta was pretty good but it isn't hard to make decent bruschetta.  The squid ink risotto was decent.  I found the seafood in the dish to be so so, it wasn't piping hot or anything but overall the dish was decent.  Now back to the waiter.  Somehow after I ordered the dish and started eating it, he started being nice to me and asking me how I like it, if I've had it, and even coming over and asking me and me only if we needed anything else.  To sum it up, I felt that he out of nowhere started respecting me or that I suddenly joined some kind of Italian dining cult because of my knowledge and liking of squid ink risotto.  (Just an fyi if he's reading, he has no idea how extensive my palate is, don't even try challenging me).    Anyway Canaletto is in the area of St. Mark's Square.  With Otto and Postrio next door, there is patio seating where you can enjoy the faux blue sky of the Venetian roof and also enjoy the entertainment the hotel provides.  I'd probably not come back because there are just too many places to eat in Las Vegas.

LFs2UQgPOg8ZA3bnoVaAdQ.text: The ambiance was good and the bread was close to authentic, but nothing else was.  The food was very Americanized and nothing spectacular. The pasta I order came with Italian meats, which turned out to be Bacon (American style)  Looking through the wine-by-the-glass list and 90% of the offerings are California wines.  Service was good, despite all the other negatives.

0rmKnpMNwT983CmvV2i9mQ.text: Bring your money and your empty stomachs. The portion size is big for an upscale restaurant. The scallops were amazing and cooked perfect. The citrus sauce over the seafood plate was refreshing on my tastebuds. The waitress was really friendly and treated us like kings. Just go in there expecting a big bill. :)

ebYjWYk_PhRG509D0HKlfA.text: Let me start by saying, I'm really only rating this based on the pizzas I've had here. I can't comment on anything else because the pizzas are so good and so reasonably priced I never pass them up.  This time I tried the Pizza Cristina...YUMMMMMM!!! "Thin-crust pizza with fresh mozzarella, Prosciutto San Daniele, shaved Grana Padano, mushrooms and baby arugula, drizzled with white truffle oil 15.99"  I've also had the marghertia and the one with spicy sausage...both also very good but not quite as good as the Cristina.  Also, the setting is great right in the middle of St. Mark's Square.   The only thing I don't like is that the Ladies' Room is on the 3rd floor.

wTlcZq_j5xHy-qvTXksXyA.text: I had the carpaccio for appetizer and the Giant prawns sauteed with paprika, garlic, capers, marinara, brandy and cream for the main course; I loved the food!

NXW9ATTzynkxUfuBNKGbJw.text: Nothing spectacular with Canaletto. Our group wanted a nice semi-fancy venue to dine at without the overpriced menu, so we stumbled upon this place during a random stroll across the Venetian. Typical Italian menu, but I was more impressed with the specials. Remember to always ask for the specials! I ended up ordering the lobster stuffed ravioli in a cream sauce and it was splendid. 6 huge pieces of ravioli was the perfect portion before a night a drunken debauchery. My friends ordered the blackened salmon (a little too blackened, if you asked me) and halibut (cooked perfectly). Our tab was about $30/person, which isn't bad when you're trying to eat fancy in Vegas.  I wasn't too impressed with the service. Our waiter was friendly and helpful when we were deciding what to order, but he didn't check up on us or offer any other assistance until dessert. I even had to ask 2 people for water before our glasses were refilled. Big negative mark in my book for that one. I might come back, but I'm sure there's better Italian restaurants to try in Vegas.

ro_Nw3lt9qHZP-9atzH2nQ.text: We were on our way to Jersey Boys, and stopped in here at the Venetian.  The fake indoor/outdoor scene was pretty cool.  Our waiter was fantastic!  The food was very good.  We had caprese for app.  I really liked it.. they bake it, so it is a bit different.  I had seabass for entre, and my wife had the lobster pasta dish... very well done.  More lobster and more tasty than the more expensive lobster dish I had at Cirque.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z623lOF7_YG_AQVDKaDjFg.text: Date: November 22, 2009 Good: Scenery & Nearby music along with the setting of Italy, service was excellent.  Bad: Not many food selections and can be expensive Ex. Spaghetti $37, food above average but nothing great Summary: Would recommended if your looking for a nice setting with great service.

Y2YP1o7FDTikuyq61wmiVQ.text: Where do I start, I gues by saying that the location of this restaurant is the highlight, however you have mario batali and wolf gang puck close by which are much better choices.  We came in with high expectations as it was recommended by the hotel staff.  Ordered calamari and bruschetta for appetizer, calamari was decent but nothing special and the bruschetta was probably the worst I ever had.   The bread was ok, but the tomatoes were salty, and they are warmed in the oven making it mushy, more salty and yucky.  enough said, not good.  0-2 for entrees we shared a margherito pizza which was pretty decent, and a seafood entree.  The pasta was hard, very undercooked, especially for my taste, seafood was plenty but the taste and sauce were lacking.   Dessert time, italian restaurants usually have decent desserts, coffee and tea were ok but took a while.  The tiramisu, came about 10 minutes before drinks, and it didnt look appetizing at all, it taste just as bad as it looked.  There was no flavor, wow, I wasted 8 bucks on lady finger cookies with cream.  Horrible, so, is it the worst in the world, no, but for the price and in Vegas there are many options.  We were so dissapointed that went to Otto next door the following night and had a much better, italian meal.  I wouldnt return to this place for free, and wouldnt recommend anyone going.  Worst than olive garden.  The chef should be ashamed of his food.

Pu3_S7GWt3rtsdyTu5lZvQ.text: Perfect for that "outdoor" dining experience.  I expected very little from the food thinking that they're probably relying on their location primarily, but I was happily surprised. The risotto and parpadelle were both excellent.  Our waiter did forget one appetizer.  Good pizza.  Good for kids.

e78IIrNX-sa5XAwHiH5cbQ.text: A modest restaurant inside the Venetian right in St. Mark's square with a lovely atmosphere, good prices and great food.  I'm a little (more like a lot) obsessed with risotto, so I was incredibly pleased to see that they had a good selection of risotto dishes on their menu. From the looks of the other dishes passing us by, their other options looked fantastic as well. I would definitely come here again!

8flBwlFl2MApShFAfptPhg.text: Very nice venue. Great food! Decent prices for a $$$ place. Ossobuco overcooked unfortunately. Would have been 4.5 stars otherwise.

lMQf6OIeCPZs71voOv5lxQ.text: The wait is nuts hostess told us 30 minutes been waiting almost an hour now.  If they say 10 more minutes we are gonna die.  When we finally did get seated the food was good and reasonably priced.  Make sure you get a table outside and make sure you keep the hostess honest on your wait.

aGm_3a61r7Wdxs9fzZnM9A.text: We had to cancel our reservation at B&B because of timing issues and ended up at Canaletto instead.  At first, I was really bummed but Canaletto really delivered.  All of our food was excellent, but I lucked out the most with the mushroom risotto.  It was absolutely PERFECT.  Rich and creamy but still light enough to eat and be full of energy for dancing later :)  Our cocktails were great, the service was fantastic.  The only thing lacking was the ambiance.  They sat us all the way in the back of the restaurant near the kitchen, so it was loud and pretty hot.  The service however, more than made up for it, as they were extra attentive because our table was out of the way and turned the AC up full blast on our request.    Definitely a great pick if you need a last minute reservation for a high quality Italian meal at the Venetian.  Expansive menu, great service and an exceptional value.

QP_QjdHlolbTBhXSFc31iQ.text: I chose this restaurant to celebrate my 31st birthday and I was not disappointed.  I am glad that I made a reservation as this place is always busy and many people are turned away due to demand.  The location is great as it overlooks the Grand Canal in The Venetian.  The wine list is excellent and the menu does not appear to have anything bad on it.  Each person in our party of four ordered something different and everything I tasted was yummy.    Our waiter was pleasant and efficient.  I even got a free piece of cake for my birthday.

ZZZW-cmg5aTNEy4SoYjqyw.text: Ah, dining outdoors at the Venetian: where concrete canals meet robins' egg blue plastered skies with the sounds of "I do" echoing eerily throughout the 'Square'.  You're in Vegas so trust me, you don't want to sit outside anyway.  Canaletto is what it is. Decent food and interesting atmosphere that costs more than it actually delivers. I've been here a few times and by Vegas standards its not too expensive. However I certainly wouldn't pay $9 for a small dinner sized salad at home, especially given that they were pretty skimpy on the blue cheese. But I've never watched anyone get married at my local Italian restaurant, so....  I would absolutely dine here again....sharing a bottle of wine, app and a salad make for a restful break before hitting the real outdoors again.

iiFLI61KAaN1ywIokvwQYg.text: Great Place, Reasonably Priced  I ate here last december with my girlfriend. We sat inside the place and not outside in the square. The ambiance was great, service was excellent and the food was outstanding. She had the salmon and I had the veal scallopini. The best part of the meal however was the bread. The waiter said it was fresh from the bakery next door. Overall the meal was excellent, and It was reasonbly priced for vegas standards, I think 65 bucks with tip for 2, but we split a salad and a calamari, but had no drinks or desserts. It was still wonderful. I highly reccomend it, for anyone.

aBR0-llOVcC4cbF743CPyg.text: Had high hopes for this place, took my girl out for date #3 I believe, had to make reservations no problem there, no problem anywhere really. But also nothing that made it stand out, other than location. It was great to set a romantic mood but I honestly did not take away any WOWs from this place. Got to ride the Gondolas in the same building so that deserves a + i guess

JZfjVBft5p_So062ewhJ8w.text: What a cute place in St. Marks Square! Had our friends Bach dinner here and everyone was soo nice! The food was superb especially the Rosotto! I really can't remember what we ordered but everything we ordered came out yummy!! Great place for a group and great place for people watching!!

yhkxNIEaMCfQOyElK-OHTw.text: One of our go-to places during our annual trip to LV.  It has for years been a lunch destination; this past week was our first try for dinner.   We weren't disappointed.   Food was delicious, service was great and we love the atmosphere of sitting "outdoors" in St Mark's Square.

O5Gvr9ZWQONPQIV_0no39A.text: Meh.  Cool atmosphere in "Piazza San Marco".  Great to try once, but the quality of food wasn't up to Vegas caliber.  For a far superior dining experience at the Venetian, try out Bouchon upstairs.

nYgQBqVUybV7wkRIQ_WzRA.text: Decent food, small portions. Slow service. "can't split a bill. " save your money.  Eat somewhere else.

1G522KivhvzPZ7CU6x8SkA.text: The atmosphere was sadly the most impressive aspect of the restaurant. The service was decent and the food was mediocre at best. I think I could have gotten a meal just as good at say an Olive Garden or Macaroni Grill...

-WOCLxTxDWGg2og34kUtlg.text: Ended up leaving. The hostess at the front was rude and judgmental AND misinforming. We came in today around 5pm. So upset wit the service we first received upon entering that we ended up leaving. Appreciate all customers cause you really don't know what kind of business you may be loosing.

JW7dYE90MkUjuhQKBUSBQg.text: I went for the lunch on my birthday and I decided to have Italian food,I loved the food that was served, I ate salad, the salmon with yukon potatoes and vegetables, it taste delicious.  I got tiramisu with coffee, a perfect combination.  We had no reservation and as soon as we arrived we were moved to a table.  All very friendly staff and excellent service.  We sat in the patio area where we could see a show of very nice opera buffoons and singers. I really recommend it, and it was not pricey at all.

0ggxKffBV_1Y5Dlb1mfBWQ.text: We have been served frozen steak, not cooked properly. Also steak was probably too old, kept in freezer too long. Anyway, i was able to get only one bite. Service was slow even though it wasn't very busy. I wouldnt eat here again. Notes: they dont have kids menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yJzFXQlaJ0C8e42quF76tg.text: This is a beautiful restaurant that serves pretty good food.  The SEPPIE NERE (risotto with shrimp, scallops & fresh Mediterranean cuttlefish with natural black ink) was delicious but the appetizer seafood platter was just so-so. The live music playing nearby in the courtyard-like area added to the beauty of this place. Will come back.

I1fdxgUO_zPdPzGa4X-tpA.text: Majorly appreciate the service and being sat even so close to closing. Awesome food , drinks, and table bread !

F9_ELlV5LOojLKSONUhZMQ.text: We visited Canaletto on a Saturday night. We sat at the bar for our dinner. That's what we, as parents, do when we don't have children with us. Still, we were able to enjoy the musical entertainment in the square, while also being able to catch the playoff game on the television.   We ordered a red blend Sangiovese bottle to start. Our server, Xavier, was fantastic and very patient with us. From being pulled away from the bar or being indecisive on the amazing menu. You know that you're in the best place for dinner when no one rushes an order out of you.   We decided to have the calamari appetizer. It was served with a spicy marinara sauce, as well as tarter sauce. Options! We love options! The calamari was marinated in a flour/milk mixture to evenly distribute the flour ahead of time so it was fried to perfection. Seriously, the rings looked perfect. But, we had started filling up on the bread and oil/balsamic dip, that we only ate about half. Such a waste, but our appetites are only so big.  For our main course, my husband wanted something light and ordered the minestrone soup. However, the restaurant had just served a large party upstairs and had run out of the soup. The kitchen offered to make him a lobster bisque. While, I don't eat shellfish, he said it was a very good, red bisque with chunks of lobster meat. There was a large crouton of Italian bread floating in the middle. He very much enjoyed his special dinner.   I ordered the homemade formaggi gnocchi. It had a four cheese sauce with Gorgonzola, stracchino, grana padano and cream. There were small pieces of asparagus mixed in, as well as added chicken that Xavier suggested. The gnocchi was tender, cooked to perfection and was "melt in the mouth" delicious. The combination of it with the sauce made it some of the best gnocchi I've had. It's inspired me to go home and perfect my own gnocchi!   Thank you for the perfect dinner for our last night in Vegas. We'll be back!

f7mkhIPr1ucsQp9qNIPVww.text: So, why am I giving them a one star bump?  Well, this Il Fornaio owned establishment did a better job with our small party of 7!  The breads served at the beginning of the meal were just as delicious as I had remembered.  The bruschetta was good tasting, packed with a generous amount of the tomato mixture.  The calamari fritti was not crispy enough though the taste was there.  The minestrone soup was on the bland side.  The spaghetti with lobster and the ribeye entrees were delicious, very generous in portion, and fairly priced (for Las Vegas).  The wife's pasta with salmon (the special of the night) was just ok.  Service started out fine but then our server rarely came back.  It seems he was more interested in waiting on people he knew.  We did not order dessert as we were so full from the rest of the meal!

EozmksMM-dn2nWVqZjrW3g.text: This is for Natasha my wedding event planner who had been simply amazing by providing the best arrangements and made my day so beautiful. She is so amazing and professional in how she handle her guests need. Service was excellent, our cake and champagne toast with thier cheese platter, calamari and the private patio non the 1st floor was more then I expected.  Recommending this place to everyone.  Big thank to Natasha, keep it up!

-BJp1wZJdRD_xxOrc6Wrzw.text: With St.Mark's Square being the entertaining spot of the Grand Canal Shoppes, the restaurants and cafes' surrounding the square all seem to have a "patio" area, or windows that overlook the stage; this area is great for people watching and enjoying the atmosphere around the Venetian, giving you a little slice of feeling like you're in Macau. All the eateries around here seem to be more Italian. Canaletto was chosen off a whim, we were hungry and decided to go to the one that looked busiest. (ikr.)   Offering refined Italian dining, with a very extensive menu ranging from charcuterie to pizza to pasta. Sure to satisfy anyone in your party I suppose. We came for lunch and there was a lunch menu offering a 3 course option for a set price, giving you options to choose from for you starter,entree and dessert.   Insalata Canaletto - Mixed greens was basically just iceberg lettuce doused with house vinaigrette. I usually get my dressing on the side but didn't think twice about it. Way too overdressed. With a thin slice of cheese just plopped on top, what presentation..   Pollo Allo Spiedo  - A slice of rotisserie chicken accompanied by roasted potatoes and sauteed vegetables. Chicken was moist and the sauce that was tangy. Not bad.   Steak dish is not on their regular menu- But basically 6oz of overcooked steak, that was barely trimmed for fat. Ordered for medium rare, came with charred burnt edges and completely cooked through. Basically chewing on rubber.  Salmone Alla Griglia - Grilled salmon fillet with a lemon-parsley sauce served with potatoes and vegetables as well. I actually really enjoyed this. Fish was cooked nicely, flaked to the touch and the lemon-parsley sauce went really well with the salmon fishy taste that gave a nice cut of fresh acidity. Consistency between all three dishes flavor wise was the underwhelming amount of seasoning that went through each dish. We ended up asking for a ketchup bottle to finish off our entrees.   Followed by dessert, Vanilla gelato and two Tiramisus'. Eh. To finish off the underwhelming meal with an equally underwhelming dessert.. Why not. Basically a tourist trap being situated in the middle of the mall overlooking the square- tourists are the only ones that would come because I don't see any reason to revisit this eatery at all.

getE4o22XlC414dXCHzF3g.text: Great location in st markos square which is full of energy and occasional music.  Food is good and worth the visit. Staff was courteous.

NEKSHpMjKE4iMjHodEbU1Q.text: We seem to keep finding our way back to Canaletto every time we are a convention in Vegas.  The restaurant itself is gorgeous, the area outside is nicely setup.  It's a great place to people watch or enjoy one of the shows.  We have worked with Mario the last few times we have been there.  He is a very welcoming presence after a long day of business.  We started off with a delicious glass of Chianti and the Caprese Salad.  Very fresh.  We had the Pennoni Al Ragu  and the Gnocchi for our entrees.  Very flavorful and fresh.  Some of the best pasta on the strip.  We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ADkQdKIOz_dwS2hAwypjhw.text: I would recommend this place for more nicer occasions such birthday dinners or work lunch/dinners. Pick the outside seating if you can!!  We started off with the bruschetta and the bread they give you (along with olive oil/balsamic). The tomatoes on the bruschetta were so fresh and it was a great appetizer. I had a pasta with seafood and it was so delicious!!! The seafood seemed very fresh and the pasta was cooked perfectly. We also got the calzone with vegetables. It was a very large portion and the flavors were amazing even though it was just filled with vegetables. We finished with the tiramisu. It was good but there was a very thick layer of coffee grounds on top of the dessert. I felt like I kept choking on it.   I like how this restaurant is a more finer "casual" dining and the servers did a great job.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood pasta

ZIpkLYd3eTJ_iqeIowGN7A.text: Service slow, no one smiles, pricey, mashed potatoes tasted like they were from a box(bland, whipped, no butter). I had liver, It was over cooked and in a sauce that wasn't good.   Wife had ribeye, and it was very good! Meh!  I wouldn't come back.

dwud30vlq612BumojGhUWA.text: Canaletto is a beautiful italian restaurant with great food and wonderful service. This was one of the few places open late for dinner, and we were not dissappointed.  The restaurant is beautifully decorated, with two indoor levels, and one 'outdoor' patio-style seating in the grand canal shoppes. Most patrons and us were seated in the patio. The inside is very royally decorated, with a dark & quiet ambiance more suited for intimate occasions, while the outside has the noisy crowd.  The service here was outstanding. We were a large group of 10, and they were able provide flawless service unlike some of our other experience in vegas, even though it was pretty crowded there. Our server was very efficient and courteous, and recommended some great wines for us.  The food was great here. We got a few pizzas, from which the margherita was the highlight, as well as some pastas to share. The gnocchi was really good, but the risotto was just alright, not too great. The portions here are meagre, so the prices here felt pretty high for the food.  This is a great restaurant, but I wouldn't recommend going out of the way for this one. It's a nice option if you're already at the venetian, specially later in the evening when other restaurants have closed.

NXVlIvTzZlDONROCR8U9KA.text: The food was amazing! The staff were so friendly and nice! Everything came at a good timely manner and waiter checked up on us often to make sure everything was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

te2MjdbDq3GKAzrgNU3wdA.text: Great value. Delicious food and wine. Would highly recommend and may go a second time. I had the swordfish special and it did not disappoint

t0OIC5ZBx8ZtLUzYXDrnhA.text: The atmosphere was awesome for this place. There was so much to look at. The service was a bit slow but it was a Friday night in Vegas so not sure if I can really compare, but our server was very friendly.   The bread that came before the meal was Just ok. I ordered the ravioli and it was very good. It was the right amount of portion to not feel bloated for a night out in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ravioli

XznwJszaEo2T4ZCHMwfp3A.text: I highly recommend this place. I got seated right away without a reservation and the host was extremely kind. The food is also great and you have a nice view of the canal. 5+ stars :)

R_-T8NhM72G1gcSvCcEUWA.text: Come to this restaurant if you want to waste over an hour waiting for you food to come, only to have it arrive incredibly cold and subpar.  The server was nice, but I would never come back here or recommend it to a friend.  We spent over an hour and a half here, waiting for food almost the entire time and our waitress never stopped by to check on us or give us an update.

8zguvlT3fu0_sXDiDO_aMQ.text: I know it's the Venetian and all the food inside is super pricey, but there are some gems in here that really make it worth having at least once.  We were having a meal with our company so I didn't personally pay for things other than my own, so I sampled most of the dishes and here's what we got:  Antipasto /Appetizers: Bruschetta: the tomatoes were delicious but nothing stood out. Seafood Sampler (Di Pesce): calamari red sauce was delicious, but otherwise just your standard seafood appetizer  Main Courses: Calzone: this guy is huge, but it's mostly filled with air and is actually smaller than those personal pizzas you get. Stagioni Pizza: Solid combination and a good filling pizza. Vermicelli: Pretty tasty pasta, honestly was one of their strengths. Veal Scaloppine: Its the dish that I ordered, but I felt that there were issues. The first was that there wasn't enough veal relative to the rest of the dish. The breaded part tasted too chewy and the veal tasted a tad harder than what I expected.  Di Manzo (22oz steak): Very rare and delicious but I keep in mind that it's fatty on one end, might be worth it if you can drop $50 Chicken: it looked aight, but nothing special that you couldn't get elsewhere. Salmon: this dish looked uninteresting, but I can't really say what it tastes like.  The food took around 20 minutes to get served. The bill surprisingly took longer. I'm not knocking the servers hard on that, I just want to have more frequent checks with the customers.  So it's a hit or miss depending on what you get. Reservations are required, but f you feel like you want to a company if around 10-20 people, try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

FizMmGucYwyPJFet_reUEA.text: A nice Italian restaurant. The ambience is super cool, being in the middle of the Venetian, you actually get to eat out in the middle of the shopping center, with the ceilings painted like the sky and a nice view of the boats that go through the canal.
