jKCnbsNslI_Nr4hwQMbrvQ.text: I thought the food here was top notch.  Ordered the Tagliatelle alla Castellana, and it was extremely delicious.  The ribbon pasta combined with the creamy brandy sauce, pork tenderloin and bacon made a perfect combination to which I never experienced before.  Service was good as well.  If you go during the right time you can hear and partially see the opera singers belting out arias.  Next time I am in Vegas I would definitely come back!

m_yluZ5FKDiiacbYJe8XPg.text: Ambience was excellent! the Ravioli with the roasted pear and cheese sauce was very unique. The filante risotto was really nice though the rice was very al dente. Gnocchi pesto was great too!

pntCrHyZ_ivqWxFKS1QMgg.text: Looked real nice from the outside. The hostess sat us and we began to look over the menus. After about 5-10 minutes nobody ever acknowledged us, I looked around and noticed several employees but it was if we were invisible. After 10 minutes of no contact from anyone we decided to leave.   As we walked out we told the hostess why we were leaving, she said the waiter must be on break... What!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YE31-HHWno3zS9Xo6bbP6Q.text: Excellent Happy Hour.  Drinks are fantastic and the pizza is excellent.  A great Happy Hour for a location on the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q42v41nw1DxOvHF2bjIVow.text: This establishment's ambiance, food and service was a perfect ending to our evening.. We were catered all the way, First Class service!!  The food was amazingly tasty.. I just loved the  ambiance..  It felt like we were in Italy.  Will definitely return..

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loving our time here..
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Us having a great time!!
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. PENNONI AL RAGU Imported pasta tubes with a traditional meat ragu and Grana Padano.. Hubby loved it!!

ZBkKUhBApv3Y9GiE14M_9g.text: Food is good. There is a vegan vegetable soup offered which was perfect for our party's dietary needs. Pizza is good!   My only complaint was that this restaurant offers a great happy hour from 4-6, but patrons can only be seated in the bar for these prices. The bar seating is limited, and patrons are advised to stand around and wait for other patrons to leave to take their table/chairs. The management and hostess were not very accommodating for our party, as all of the tables were taken and we had 2 minors with us. However, two servers were VERY helpful, and made sure to help us get a table without looking like vultures - Xavier and Adelia, thank you for your kindness!   My advice to the restaurant management is to rethink the seating options to accommodate more people who patronize the business between 4-6 pm for the happy hour prices.

DIL2AYsXrJccHNd3MCkKbw.text: I fell in love with the Venetian Square...the shows, the atmosphere, the food. We had some good ravioli, soups and calf's liver (not bad for those who tried to be vegetarian).

iXUKsmQg6iTHhn2HExl7mA.text: Excellent all around what a great service and atmosphere and food. We will be coming back for sure next time when we in town. Ask for Italy our wonderful waiter what a nice gentlemen he was

tz5S8EhOcUr39Ox37XsqXA.text: We were here at happy hour, the drink and food are alright. Service is slow, our server is okay but pretty busy. We waited 15 mins and we asked a server pass by to check in our food. His immediate response is, "it comes when the food is ready!" We were shocked with this response and our server walked by, he simply repeat that and walk away with an attitude. They food finally took 30 mins to come and we just have them to box up food and we left. The one star is for our server. The other one is rude.

Ia3UprAAdC2w-K6MW5VzTw.text: Excellent place with a perfect view to stage performances. Great staff, very friendly. Love the food here. The bread and butter served is great and my favorite dish in here is cannelloni Di Pollo..top that with a dessert vine...they have a large variety to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

haJw1WidgPoAVUQEk3SX3w.text: I haven't been inside but the patio area has great atmosphere and is a good place for people watching.  Had their angel hair pasta which was simple and light but over priced for what it was.

oXk42VeiPNjiUXNuc8qP6w.text: We stayed at The Palazzo for the second time in a year. After a mix up at Morel's on our last night, we opted for Italian. We selected Canaletto for the food, wine and people watching. We waited for 20 minutes and enjoyed some wine at the bar. Once seated, we enjoyed some excellent italian food. Being from Philadelphia, we enjoy great restaurants, especially italian places, but this delivered. We had some apps, pizza and entrees and all were excellent. Service and venue were up to task. This is now in the Vegas rotation.

cgQ4vybu0Xn_4H0vuzNQ6Q.text: Came here at night and the seafood was really good.  The tables in the area of the Venetian are great for people watching.  Me and the gf liked this place and the service was good too.

KbP4Br4_gOVcFZCHT5h8bw.text: Wow! I was skeptical. Having traveled abroad, the restaurants on the piazza are usually a disappointment. This place defied the stereotype.  The food & service were amazing.  We had risotto with asparagus and chicken, and an exceptional Cesar salad(I know, how exceptional can a Cesar salad be? But it really was) Great experience overall.

5qvuZpZrLt9NDIWcoJkwaQ.text: Caneletto's is always in the plan when going to Vegas.  Their food is always outstanding and the atmosphere is second to none!  Service can be hit or miss, but always very professional.  Many times we have had a server that we had a little issue understanding and were a little intimidated by (try pronouncing their menu items without completely butchering their native language!  Just point...it's easier!) as we have gotten a little eye roll after attempting to pronounce our entree selection...but this time we had a sever that started out amazing.   Very easy to understand (even HE didn't speak Italian, so there was no worry about mispronunciation!) he even talked me into jumping out of my comfort zone of the same 2 dishes each and every time I go there, into a FABULOUS new fave....   Tagliatelle Alla Castellana Con Pollo ...   I was excited to have him as a server and looked forward to interacting with him throughout the meal for possible other choices for after dinner drinks, coffee and/or dessert.  Unfortunately, he dropped off the drinks, took our order and he didn't come back to the table until we were finished with our HUGE meals (yet he walked right by about 6-8 times) and were ready for the check.  The food although was perfection!  Still will be on out must-do list for Vegas, but is a solid second choice to Stack at Mirage.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tagliatelle Alla Castellana Con Pollo. Absolutely delicious!

3VccpPY3Zzuih1S1SverBQ.text: I had my wedding reception here last Sunday, and I am so glad that we chose Canaletto. The meal was absolutely delicious and the waitstaff was very friendly and helpful. Everyone kept saying that this was the best wedding dinner they ever had, which was exactly what I was hoping for! The event coordinator was very accommodating in allowing my mother to come in early to decorate the Il Moro room. All of the staff was kind and easy to work with. Everything was perfect and the staff really made sure that we had a wonderful experience. The Canaletto made sure that the happiest day of my life was filled with wonderful food and a great experience for all of our guests. Thank you!!! **The table and chair decorations were provided by my mother, event specialist at redcarpeteventdesignandr...

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our Wedding Reception. Decorations provided by www.redcarpeteventdesignandrentals.com
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our Wedding Reception. Decorations provided by www.redcarpeteventdesignandrentals.com

nzdJaifH0ZLz_9jiTymumg.text: Located in Venetian near the living statue performers towards back.   Two different trips and visits. First visit was last March. Recent visit confirmed our opinions of the restaurant.   Each time we were friendly greeted and escorted by the hostess to the table and bar respectively. Each visit the courteous servers and bartenders were efficient to exchange pleasantries and to take drink orders.   Both trips we ordered pizzas and wine. First trip we ordered a salumeria assortita. Included int eh salami sampler was coppa, speck, bresaola, salame de parma, prosciutto san daniele. Salami sampler was a balance of savory, spicy, and smoked salumi meats. Also served was freshly made bread with vinegarette and oil. Bread was warm and soft. We finished like three baskets before the end of the meal.   Second trip we had the bruschetta. Fresh tomatoes and cheese on a grilled ciabatta. A simple overpriced bruschetta. Ciabatta bread was a little more grilled than expected. Tomato helped to draw out some of the toughness seen with bread used for bruschetta. Otherwise little bruschetta for price paid.   For the pizzas we have ordered the salsiccia piccante and calzone.   Salsiccia with sausage, peppers, onion, mozzarella, and pepperoni sauce. Ingredients generously found on slice of the pizza. Fresh hot out of the oven. Bursting with aroma and strong on flavors was the pizza. This was a good pizza and it will leave you full.   Calzone with mushroom, mozzarella, ricotta, and ham. A fairly sized calzone with equal amounts of the various ingredients. Hints of sweetness from the sauce and seasoned appropriately for the encumbering the hot meat cheese and vegetables. Crust was a little burnt but not to the point of hurting the taste.  Each visit we have had wine. Large selection and good recommendations of the bar staff can be found here. One of the choices became one of my favorites. William Hill Chardonnay, Central Coast 2012. Crisp refreshing and sweet.   Staff is personal and knowledgeable of menus. Service and kitchen are efficient. Food is okay overall with some stellar plates and some plates with some minor corrections needed. Regular prices are competitive and happy hour deals are fairly good.   Overall three stars. Would be four stars without burnt calzone and the  lackluster bruschetta. Will likely be back for happy hour wine and pizzas.

mC3_-743NupmNxmB_eQcOg.text: Located inside the Venetian shoppes on the 2nd floor, I saw the menu for this place and immediately made reservations for dinner. We love Gnocchi and saw that they had several Gnocchi options on the menu. We were seated in the large patio area and was able to people watch during our meal, which is always a lot of fun. After browsing the menu, we decided to order: Quattro Formaggi Gnocchi, $18.99 yelp.com/biz_photos/cana... Risotto w/Truffles & Wild Mushroom, $25 yelp.com/biz_photos/cana... Chocolate Cake & Ice Cream yelp.com/biz_photos/cana... The Risotto dish we ordered was not on the menu, but the server said they would custom build a dish for us if we had a request. The Better Half loves Wild Mushrooms and Truffles, so she told the server and the chef put together this dish for her. I had a few bites and it was awesome! Sometimes all you have to do is ask. I had the Gnocchi and it was also very good. They were soft and pillowy and a little al dente....there's a trick to cooking Gnocchi well and they have it down pat here. The Cheesy and Creamy Sauce was perfect. For dessert, we split a Chocolate Cake and Ice Cream....actually, I only had 1 bite. TBH ate the rest of it....LOL. It was very rich and sweet....perfect after a nice meal. Our server was awesome.....very attentive and willing to go the extra mile to ensure our dining experience was top notch. I'll definitely be back. Return Factor - 100%

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Cake and Ice Cream
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rissotto
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quattro Formaggi Gnocchi, $18.99

DQxbv-OMKKU9J9Z3iyGmLA.text: This could be one of the worst Italian dining experiences I've ever had. Ambience was great and so was service but the pasta dishes were all terrible. They were clearly re heated in the microwave because the plates were extremely hot but the pasta was cold. The sauces also had no flavor. I would take Olive Garden over Canaletto any day of the week. Very pricey for a very disappointing meal.

7Ch9Q62ut4GcBdnUfWlHfQ.text: The atmosphere was fun, sitting in the patio area. The food was excellent. Too often you eat at Italian places the let you down, as if they've taken it from a can. This is not the case here. From the Calamari, to the Wine, to our main dish, everything was spot on. All that said, the best part of the evening was our waiter. Jesse recommended the wine pairing, as well as our entree. It could not have been better. I would highly recommend a visit to Canaletto and make sure you ask to sit in Jesse's section. He will take great care of you and enhance your experience.

08Zju70MCuTUAUi_BgkUmw.text: Location, Location, Location! If you're fortunate enough to be seated on the piazza, you actually feel transported to St. Mark's Square in Italy. The atmosphere is lovely and  the street performers are a welcome bonus. The food was delicious - perfectly cooked pasta and the jumbo prawns were so sweet and tender, just perfect! Our server was such a delight, she made the meal even better! The only negative thing I could possibly say is that the kitchen seemed to be a little slow getting the entrees out, so plan to dine here when you've got a block of free time to enjoy the experience.

WA9qdOl_GzV_eOImlaCKwg.text: I have some mixed feeling about this place....   When it comes to the staff - 5 Stars! They are over the top, bend over backwards nice/friendly. They go above and beyond to make sure your meal/experience is a good one.   When it comes to the food - it breaks down in two sections. Let's start off with the 5 star section.   The bread (I know who rates the bread...me) is delicious. I could make a meal of just eating a loaf or two. And the penne ala vodka is lick the bowl good. The pasta is homemade and the sauce is perfect. Literally I wanted to lick the bowl :-) Oh and the pear four cheese ravioli - OH MY GOD - It was brought out for us just to sample with our meals. So rich and delicious, I was cursing myself that I didn't order it as my main meal.   However the fried shrimp, bruschetta and risotto ball is about three stars. The shrimp and risotto ball were a bit over fried and greasy for me and the bruschetta was a bit dry. The salad and steak were also three stars. The salad was average - nothing too exciting on the place. And the steak was just so-so. Sadly, I could have cooked a better one at home (for a third of the price). Not to mention, I really didn't like the sides - roasted potato and a sprinkling of mixed vegetables. Again, nothing to write home about.

jOmOf1MQjy6xQmuS5gzfow.text: Service was horrible! Food was decent and there was a nice wine selection. Our server was a mere order taker and was borderline rude. This dinner was a splurge for us and we were left wishing we would have made a different choice. Do yourself a favor and get your order to go!

65HJT4M17IK7PC-7bIqJUg.text: If the Italians played like canaletto cooks, they'd have dominated the world cup in South Africa this year.  This place is sensational and here is why:  1.  Location: right in the heart of grand canal shops, along the canal itself, set across from street performers barking out opera classics like bocelli's time to say goodbye among others.    2.  Space: huge, 5 rooms, multi level and incredible detail even down to the bathrooms.  3.  Lest us not forget the cuisine.  How the hell they get the freshest ingredients in the middle of the desert I do not know, but the oysters, basil, mushrooms, mozzarella, risotto, fish, beef, etc was to dine for!  We had many items but were most pleased with the risotto - best ever!  pizza - quattro stagioni...yummy, fresh oysters on the half shell (high quality & frrrrresh), caprese, chicken cataloni.  4.  Service.  Genuine Italiano's wait on you in fun little suits.  How cool is that?    5.  Bread.  I know this is a weird category, but they bread provided along with olive oil/vinegar combo disappeared like the city of pompei.  So friggin good.    6.  Consistency.  We were in vegas for 4 nights, and managed to dine here...3 times!!!  Even more impressive was that we stayed at other hotels and went to great lengths to get here each time.  The only room for improvement here is on the beverages.  If this is Italy then I want Limonata - (san pellegrino) and chocolate sprinkles on my cappuccino.  Other than that, this place is perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters on Half Shell
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese

UvIPIBN6b8nvx-Z5RGZgqA.text: 3 STARS (1 Star for the Food, 2 Stars for the Ambiance)  My bf and I choose Canaletto as our last stop for a late lunch before heading back home to SF. The prices seemed decent considering it was in the Venetian, and the ambiance was beautiful. So, Canaletto it was.  Service was slow, but good thing the ambiance was amazing--views of St. Mark's Square! It gave you the feeling of eating outdoors although you were actually inside (i.e . paintings of bright blue skies). Also, there was free bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar you can enjoy while you waited for your meal. The bread was nice & warm and oil/vinegar paired well with it.      We ordered the Pizza Con Salsiccia and Pennoni Al Ragu:  *Pizza Con Salsiccia (Pizza with Spicy Sausage): Ehh, BAD! The crust was hard, and the base of the pie was chewy not crispy. It was extremely oily; there were oil wells throughout the pizza. The sausage was suppose to be spicy but it wasn't.  And, the bell peppers was clearly out of the can (it was a faded green color and drenched in oil) and was inedible. So, needless to say, this combination made me feel nauseas afterwards.   *Pennoni Al Ragu: Essentially penne with meat sauce was just ok; nothing special. The penne was cooked al dente, just the way I like it. But, the meat sauce tasted like Prego and didn't have much depth of flavor to it. BTW, you have to ask for Parmesan cheese, they don't give it to you--weird!  The only saving grace for Canaletto is the location which is breathtaking.  Just to note, after eating, we passed by Postrio's and noticed the pricing was similar to Canaletto. Gosh darn it, we should have went there instead! Well, there's always next time...

qxOqSpx9o_pdSFADcwhkvQ.text: If you want a quick, light lunch, the bar service at Canaletto might be right up your alley.  Bar staff are congenial, you don't have to squeeze yourself into a "patio" table, and drinks/food come quick.  The fried sardines with olive oil, peppercorns, and vinegar-pickled onions was probably the best thing I've had to eat so far this week. Large sardines are butterflied, very lightly battered, deep fried, and chilled. Dressed with the oil and onions, you get the rich oiliness of the fish, the peppery olive oil and peppercorns, and then the tart vinegar onions cut through and freshen the whole thing up. I sopped up every last bit of the plate with crusty bread.  Insalata di Pere is a pear salad with very fresh young greens, radicchio, fennel, bleu cheese, toasted pecans, red grapes, and a light olive oil and lemon dressing. Very fresh flavors, and went very well with the chilled fish. Add in a cold Peroni and it's a perfect lunch break.

YjWAH099HR7iDpDpiwVHIA.text: We made Valentine's Day reservations for four and were seated right away! I was so worried about a wait, but we had no wait at all! The waiter was very prompt with food and drink and I think he was from Italy! The risotto was to die for and I am still craving the olive bread! The only downside was long trek up two flights of stairs for restroom, but at least it was clean and well decorated! We will definitely go here again because it brought back fond memories of our honeymoon in Venice :)

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prego!

4gxWeGfnjeg4PsZyOu2Skg.text: Very disappointed in this restaurant. . Service was ridiculously slow. They forgot our bread. The food took forever and when we finally got our risotto that was asparagus and chicken it was just asparagus. The server was nice enough to take it off the bill but that's not the point. For it being a pricy restaurant they sure weren't on their game. The food was meh. So We won't be going back.

e_mXp4n8WPH8W_1bGOQJ-w.text: Food was pretty good.  Our friends had the linguine and mussels/seafood, my husband had the penne pasta with meat sauce and I had a chicken lasagna baked in bechamel.... Which was my least favorite . The setting outside in St. Marks Square is a five star atmosphere!  Worth the trip

QwK9eCbJkpz17m3MjY6OHA.text: Been here a few times when were in town and you can't beat the ambiance. The bread is to die for, they are owned by Il Fornaio. I had the seafood risotto everytime and it's freaking delicious! Long wait so make a reservation. Love this place, 5 stars for sure!

xgL5CaZLhQQPG_HVNGW9Cg.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Vegas. I always go when I visit. I have never had a bad experience, the food is awesome and so is the service. Great location inside the Venetian mall with inside or out on the "porch" seating to see the gondola's go by, etc. I would say the best thing is the awesome dessert tray they will bring to your table, it has like 15+ choices that all look and taste amazing.

5c6wJCZ0AIINUNaixu9Qdw.text: Loved it! Great atmosphere, great food and great service! Singing opera show was an added bonus! I had the Lobster spaghetti...it was terrific! Wow!! You've got to try it! If you have any room left get the crespelle di mele, it was a apple filled crepe with vanilla ice cream but it too was delicious! Can't wait to go back!

EJsBFnz-3ZSEc_7da71GHQ.text: I expected this to be a touristy overpriced cheesy restaurant but I was mistaken. I had the ribeye steak it was cooked exactly the way I asked and the vegetables that came with it were cooked perfectly definitely a five star in the middle of St. Mark's Square!

AWFbMMqmsEYK4e3mszq0aA.text: Went for lunch on a Wednesday and service wasn't very good.  Took a long time for bread and took a long time to order.  Food was pretty good and ambience is fun.

FBLAQWwvfAdDJl-iLajwNg.text: Best Italian food in vegas!  Decent prices but well worth every penny. Also nice atmosphere

cD5BvW_mmGrty7O9UmXxYw.text: Still searching---just finished dinner at this lovely restaurant. Sat on the patio so I could take in the entertainment and varied assortment of people passing. The service was outstanding, however, the food failed miserably. I had the risotto with shrimp, crab and artichokes. It was tasteless, undercooked, overpriced and didn't improve with salt.   My cocktail, a lemon drop, which I choked down was so bland and uninteresting.   I will say as I have before, the best one I've had was at Maggiano's at Fashion Show Mall. I was so looking forward to this dining experience as I've strolled by on many different occasions and thought it would be the ideal place.  NOPE!

vFd0hlJNtcVPlJIELI9Qsg.text: This restaurant is located in the heart of the Venetian, and is surrounded by the shoppes and the beautiful gondola ride.  Reservations are a must as waiting times can be lengthy. We had drinks while we waited and I must say that prices for top shelf are rather decent.  We had the oysters, and they were as fresh as possible. Then my friends ordered the squid ink risotto, and the tagliatelle alla castellana, while I had the Oso Bucco. All dishes were solid, service was good as well.  Nice dining experience, can't go wrong with Canaletto.

0ZDyJnmXXhEmFjhViQO-kQ.text: Holy crikey...I never thought I could fall in love with Risotto, but the Wild Mushroom Risotto sent a chill down my spine!  I stopped by this place completely on a whim and not even bother researching it (bad Yelper, i know!) and boy were we not disappointed! My party and I were tired after a long day of shopping at the Grand Canal and stopped by for lunch here. We each got something fairly different and the were not disappointed.  The margherita pizza offered a great flavor profile and the freshness of the product clearly came through. The potato gnocchi was simply fantastic and while I was never a big fan of gnocchi, I quickly became one.  The wine list is very extensive and not bad considering this is vegas! Great place to check out and if this isn't what Italian should taste like, yikes, I am never staying at the Venetian again!

KNTin4XJD29aB5WoGOLC7Q.text: Totally unimpressed.  Food: pretty ordinary American-Italian, mostly what you'd expect from a crappy chain restaurant in the middle of nowhere.  They don't use enough salt or spice.  Pasta was cooked properly, which (given how bland the sauce was) surprised me.  The salads weren't fresh, neither were the tomatoes.  In winter, this is forgivable, but not in mid-June.  Service: Inattentive, mostly useless.  Glacially slow, had so much difficulty in charging the meal to my room that I gave up and switched to my credit card.    Ambiance: The cheap plastic chairs have seen better days: they look like hell, and they're uncomfortable.  The restaurant doesn't iron their tablecloths and napkins, so the tables look ratty.  It's "outside", as it were, on St Mark's Square in the Venetian.  They're obviously relying on the Venetian's surroundings for their ambiance.  The china is chipped and scratched.    I won't bother going back.

Bnu7_Ez2du7j2oqY8wZE_Q.text: Not good. Olive oil a little bitter. Margarita pizza was blah. Crust was way too thing and droopy. Fried veggies were ok.

D2IC9AnarA8Ib7NhciiDVA.text: I looked up many places for dinner, but Yelp pushed me to finalizing my dinner reservations for Super Bowl Sunday at Canaletto.  We were seated inside of the restaurant since we didn't want to wait for outdoor seating and was placed near an open window that outlooks some of the shops and the gondalas.  The service here was great, even though I think they were a bit excited to come help us in terms of clearing the plates as they swept away one of the oysters that way.  However, we took it all in stride and were happy to see that our entrees came soon after.  The table mostly stuck to eating seafood dishes and we loved it.  I enjoyed my grilled seafood dish and took a bite of my friend's pizza cristie and was equally as in love.   Overall, a great atmosphere, good food, and we had a great time.  It's definitely a restaurant I wouldn't mind trying out again on the strip!

Tm3QyvJoeJMqvjMBxEI3AA.text: WOW!  This restaurant was delicious!!!!  We watched a show at another hotel and came here for a late dinner.  Waiters are friendly and courteous and the food is delicious.  We ate in the plaza, but I went to check out the rooms in the 2nd level (there is a second level where the restrooms are), and man, they are beautiful.  They got rooms with windows facing the plaza (st. Mark's Square), or you can be in the room facing the canal and see the gondolas row by.  The food is superb!  Everyone try it!

-xv-sY4PYPxANCUs_Vh3_g.text: I went to Canaletto last month while staying at the Venetian for a work conference. My whole experience at Canaletto was a great one. The food, the service, and the ambiance were all magnificent.  For dinner, I had the Scaloppine con funghi e speck, which was veal scaloppine topped with portobello mushroom, fontina and speck (think prosciutto), all served with grilled polenta ($26). I enjoyed every bite of this delicious meal. I also enjoyed several glasses of a delicious pinot noir, which one I couldn't tell you.  Thankfully, when I went to Canaletto, it was for a work dinner so the bill wasn't on me because it is a bit pricey for someone in their young 20s.  I will highly recommend Canaletto.

hATkAzfDYwC4oHcU_M3d4w.text: For the first time in a long time, I felt I was eating something different than the usual vegetarian pasta/pizza in an italian ristorante.  Husband and I ordered the mushroom risotto and a stuffed pear ravioli dish. The risotto was crunchy (it had pine nuts) and cheesy without being too heavy. The pear ravioli dish was out of this world good. I was a little hesitant before ordering this as I thought the pear might make the dish sweet but that was not True. It had a balance of all flavors.  Service was very friendly. The olive oil/balsamic with bread at the start were tasty too. I just wanted other variety of bread besides the ciabatta served but they were all out of their sesame and wheat rolls.  Pretty reasonably priced- bill for 2 was 60 bucks for these 2 dishes+gratuity. It is located in St Mark's Square in the Grand Canal Shoppes so a good opportunity to catch some show there with dinner.  I am definitely returning on my next trip to Vegas!

9eENu5jKuL78wrhX0WoihA.text: Horrible and way over priced. The service was horrendous. The atmosphere is fun but not worth the price.

JGh9RXLeS6JYhJaQ65R-KA.text: The location is awesome, of course! The service; however, is horrible! My friend had her reception there this past weekend. We waited for hours to get our drinks ordered...then, we waited another 1.5 hours for our food to arrive. The room was reserved from 4-7pm, and we did not start eating until 6:15ish! You tell me if that's rude and unprofessional! The fact that my friend reserved the room weeks in advanced and they're a restaurant is unacceptable! They ruined the ambience (because people were starving!) and managed to give my friend (the bride) an anxiety attack! They should be use to accommodating a large party and getting orders in on time! Bottom line, I will never come back to Canaletto!! Stick to the buffets if you want to eat good food!   Only reason I'm given them 2 stars is because the waiter was patient and had a sense of humor! The slowness was evidently out of his control!

8iNb35Jg8VMTfEaP2BIXrQ.text: My friend and I went there right away when we got in for lunch. Location is great - right in the atrium of the Venetian. They put on shows with singers and you can watch free entertainment. Also by the canals.   Prices were very reasonable for the amount and quality of food. We started with a drink and soup of the day - DIVINE. Both got sizable entrees. I got the fish of the day which was melt in your mouth delicious and my friend got the pasta which was very freshly made. Then we got free dessert for a birthday we celebrated. Great authentic Italian customer service. Highly recommend going there for a meal.

JUaKR6N01qYwSL0k2Aeqfw.text: On a whim while visiting the Venetian, my son and I had a quick dinner at Canaletto. We both had amazing dishes of risotto--each one different, but not skimpy on the ingredients. The real deal. Fresh parm on request. Great bread basket. Wine by the glass was tasty. Ambiance was as close to Italy as one can get (with the wait staff in tan jackets or striped shirts) in a mall setting. We had a great time and did not break the bank.

qKV_MWsvdfN4zAUMwgogPw.text: Definitely not worth the price. They tried to seat us in the back corner by the elevator when the rest of the restaurant was available which they tried to sell to guests after us as well. The waiter was missing for 30 minutes at a time and wasn't very attentive considering it wasn't very crowded. The food was the best part of it but portions were tiny. The bill for our party of 5 turned out to be close to $200. Terrible service, tiny portions, pricey.... so one star

vzMEHnke51gSMTSavN48pQ.text: Worst service ever. The staff  had a horrible attitude. We were there for my friends wedding and we were a large party. The manager and the waiters were rude. We were overcharged and none of the guests (over 20 people) had a good time. The food was average. I would skip it if i was you unless you want to deal with dissapointment

9NpkcFWm3CPcxg3KuKLSTQ.text: solid place for italien food in vegas. we were walking around the mall and needed a quick lunch so this worked well.  we were able to sit down quickly and found good items on the menu.  The risotto was great, pizza was pretty solid and the bread was great.  nothing spectacular, we are from boston and have the north end, but for a quick bite it was a nice place.  good people watching as well.

L9ARjT7qkaoizvIYgh_qIw.text: I had my wedding reception here and not only was the groom and I pleased but all of our guests as well!! All of the food was delicious- salmon, ravioli, chicken, and veal, Chicken caesar salad, minestrone soup, bruschetta, and bread. The service was swift and considerate. The maitre'd was attentive and kind. I hope to return next time i am in vegas and definitely for an anniversary dinner!

7q3WHUHnI2nLYe4vRAXKKQ.text: Decent food in a decent restaurant by a decent staff.  Nothing horrible yet nothing memorable.  You could do better and you could do worse.  I guess that is three stars.

oLKKFjsjbuokj1Qm12WBoQ.text: Ate here 3 times in a week, none of the meals was particularly good. There was nothing memorable from the pasta, chicken, or the salad I had tried. Nothing was "bad", but nothing to write home about, that's for sure.

3KN2KZl0TXaPZ6RWbCOY_A.text: Very disappointed with this restaurant. waiters and atmosphere were great but it goes downhill from there. Most of the food was terrible. First ordered a ribbon pasta with mushrooms and chicken, the chicken was hard and almost tasteless. The margarita pizza was very oily. The other pizza we got had olives, tomatoes and some other veggies, very oily and tasted salty.  Really the only good thing was the atmosphere and that's not enough.

uJNoo22xksLuTtp1StaVWg.text: I ended up here simply because of the location - we were running late for our reservations elsewhere and needed a quick bite to eat before Blue Man Group. The menu hanging outside the entryway looked good, so we took a chance.  The food was actually really good. Unfortunately it was barely lukewarm when they brought it to us.... cold might be more accurate, but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. It had obviously been sitting in back too long.   The service was awful. Our waiter was very abrasive and never even introduced himself! At our first encounter he only said one word: "drinks?"   The location was perfect for our needs, but unfortunately we sat on the "patio," which halfway through our meal was interrupted with the San Marcos Square performances. It was loud anyway, and when you add in a loudspeaker vocal performance, talking was out of the question.   The price was decent for what you'd expect in a strip casino.   I won't be going back.

8QznYThCj9L_oPsL413pnA.text: I enjoyed my dinner!   As others have said, the ambiance is really amazing...you feel like you're eating at a restaurant in the streets of Italy! There's even a fake "sky" on the ceiling. haha. This restaurant fits in nicely with the rest of the Venetian- very classy.    We came here after watching Mystere and it was 9 pm...we were tired and didn't want to wait 30-40 minutes for a table so we agreed to sit at the bar.  That was cool because we got a good view of the olympics and got to chat with the bartender.  He told us that his favorite dish was the pear ravioli (though we didn't go with his recommendation).    I ordered the Filetto di Branzino al Proseco E Zafferano which is a seabass served over sauteed spinach.  The fish was fresh and cooked to perfection.  So moist! The portion of fish was pretty generous and I thought I'd only eat half of it but ended up eating all of it...not wanting it to go to waste.  I recommend this if you want something refreshing and light. My bf got the Petto di Pollo al Peperocino which is a free-range spicy chicken breast over sauteed spinach.  He wasn't that wowed by his dish but he got what he ordered: chicken.  I had a taste of it and it is pretty spicy...so be warned if you are not a fan of spice.  I also enjoyed the bread that they give you before your meal.  It's definitely freshly baked: crunchy on the outside and warm and fluffy on the inside.   On this Vegas trip, Canaletto was one of my favorite meals.  I would come back because the food was good and fresh...but also because I'm low key obsessed with the Venetian... :)

1Ri1zRSsZb1kbneBpej_xQ.text: fire the girl with the short red hair. she is rude. bye. ariel wanna be needs to be fired.

VTkuisNkHMrxt1lMp45_vQ.text: Authentic italian food  with the views of the Grand Canal. I had the best tiramisu here it wasn't very sweet it was just right. Yes it is pricey but the service, food, and location makes up for it. Came here with my family on a vacation didn't have reservations we didn't have to wait. Was seated right away. The bill for lunch came in under $90 bucks I believe. But it all depends on what you order and how much it will cost.   I will comeback here to experience it all over again.

G-YWz4775t1UmCXlOZtfBg.text: The eggplant risotto was delicious as was the entire meal. The service, however, was sub-par. Waited almost 30 minutes for water and about the same for the check which made the meal too long even with the great location.

HV8rG4XHaRn8aybhRyA53A.text: We "kidnapped" a friend for her birthday and all went out to Canaletto our second night in Vegas. The first night (Olives), did not impress, however we loved Canaletto. The food was amazing, wine list was great and fairly priced (unlike so many other places in Vegas), our server was very attentive and the ambiance was fun too. We were all very happy with our food and drinks, and that in itself is a major achievement.

VeUrZC0icZoqWgB-ZuON3A.text: Wonderful Happy Hour here, second time in two weeks. Service is excellent, happy hour menu is wonderful, food is delicious and ambiance is great!  The pizza is delicious, although not crispy crust, octapus and calamari appetizers very tasty, LOVE the Ginger Mojito! This is a perfect, fun, lively slice of Vegas life...definitely worth the visit and the experience!

lgmV4lOIsQ5dwdJk7c6a2Q.text: The food is mediocre, like any Italian place.  Nothing special.  The free bread was good tho, ha!  I must say, the service was fantastic tho and the drinks were on point.  I had the bloody mary with the house vodka and my friend had the sangria.  Both delicious.  I would definitely be back for the drinks and service.   We were staying at the Venetian so parking wasn't an issue, but if you're not staying at the Venetian, valet.  It's free to park, just make sure to tip your valet guy/gal.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria &amp; bloody Mary!

KwmQu8RssO_Y0vh2leViPw.text: Truthfully, we ended up going here because our 1st & 2nd choices were having private events (due to several conventions going on). But we were very impressed.  We weren't too hungry so our family of 4 shared the insalata di pare, Cristina pizza, and the Tagliatelle Alla Castellana Con Pollo. Everything was delicious. The thin crust pizza was crispy;  we've had the same type of pizza at other restaurants and have found the toppings to make the crust soggy. The pasta was perfectly cooked al Dante. A great find!

1hVe6jBXLAGtXQ8miguGPg.text: Another great meal. Must stop when In Vegas pizza are for individual but worth being stuffed

kzbUPl-91a37XSiPBOhvQw.text: Bread basket was cold and hard, no butter...oil and vinegar was good but with the bad bread it was no good, we ordered caprese salad they put it on the opposite side of us and someone ate it,  their was a group of 12....A restaurant waiter should know who ordered what,  entree was rotisserie chicken it was dry,  and arvtgr end their cappuccino machine was down,  so we couldn't order anything...just BAD all the way around

fENBkZ2KxvzoRbzpRYAxRw.text: We waited one hour to get our meal after ordering. Other people who came after us got their food and left by the time we finally got our food. Very slow service After the food finally arrived at least it was good

ZAiEjpKgmOFaOmFBbczBHQ.text: Hubby and I came for a late lunch.  Our cocktails were yummy!  I had the gnocchi Fromagge... EXCELLENT!!!.... hubby had the Bigoli (basically a chubby spaghetti and meatball dish)... also DELICIOUS!  Our service was great, Gilbert was very attentive and helpful.

1bwuxmqcZkMViNBP547z9w.text: The service is really fast. The oysters were juicy and plump. Other entrees and appetizers were okay. The desert for me was good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mYHHotos36LXmNjBpC00Vw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas, they have the best happy hour!  I have 2 young daughters who were with us, we arrived at 4:20 pm, it was already packed so we wound up waiting an hour.  What set this whole experience apart was our very professional server Xavier.  He was spot on in getting our table ready quickly, taking our orders and delivering everything perfectly. The food was amazing but what set apart was Xavier.  Thanks Xavier for making our dinner a memorable (in a good way!) evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mG_0xDbIpwcW3tSk0LsbAA.text: We actually didn't mean to eat at Canaletto.  The restaurant we were supposed to eat at was the one across the way where we ate a year ago, but I couldn't remember the name when looking on opentable.  Instead, the name Canaletto came in my mind, and so I made a reservation here.  When we got to the restaurant, we immediately knew we booked the wrong place.  After checking yelp stars and reviews, we were skeptical but decided to stay anyway.   We're glad we stayed and didn't let yelp reviews persuade us to switch restaurants.    My Linguine alla buranella was a perfect blend of tomatoes, wine, and seafood.  It was easily one of the best seafood pasta I've had.    My bf (a foodie) tried their Bigoli, and he said his pasta was also flavorful.

HsnxFHDSs3AcUNKVlwgsdA.text: This is the second time I came here! Food was delicious! My friend and I ordered Branzino al sale o alla griglia which is baked Seabass under salted crust!! This was awesome! We also ordered risotto!! Very good!  Definitely come back here again

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Seabass under salted crust
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Risotto

H7eF9H9Iv_i0dfsC65n-mA.text: Hands down the BEST gnocchi I've ever had. These babies were so fluffy - like clouds in your mouth. The bolognese was a rich and savory compliment. My only complaint is I wish the portion was bigger - I can't get enough of them.

3Vz007KUiy1pseby11vN2Q.text: The Italian "al fresco" ambiance is everything here, but the A+ food and service makes this restaurant all the more worthwhile.   My mom and I happened to be strolling by St. Marks Square inside The Venetian on a Tuesday evening and saw that their happy hour special was still going on. It's a beautiful restaurant, so we thought... why not?   Folks getting the happy hour deal are confined to the outdoor bar area, but we were able to snag a two-seater tallboy (part of the bar area) facing the square which was a total win. Great views all around! My mom ordered the octopus salad and I got the carpcaccio / arugula dish. Both appetizers were very tasty. Our server also gave us a free bread basket, which we were jazzed about since only patrons having "real" dinners are supplied with those.  What a delicious, stunning memorable meal.  Sidenote: Their happy hour deal is quite the steal and highly recommend coming here then:             -Sunday-Thursday 4-6pm: Pizzas, Appetizers and Specialty Cocktails = $7!!

drvDUfhR_HC-sHmREvCgDQ.text: Canaletto is set at the Canal Shoppes at the Venetian.  Most of their seating is outside in the "lobby" of the shopping area, which leads to very high levels of ambient noise.  The food was ok - I expected better from somewhere with high ratings.  My pasta with seafood has shellfish that hadn't opened. Service was slow.  It was an ok dinner, but not something I'd seek out with so many options right there.

72pmggYK_-SaMiEPqiEJXA.text: Came to Vegas over the weekend to celebrate my 25th birthday, just to eat here. Hands down my favorite Italian restaurant. Our favorites to get- pizza Christina, the fresh oysters, ribeye steak, and lobster spaghetti( but I get it with linguini pasta instead). Service is always great, food is always better. Counting down the day until we come back!

KTv8Evx0W2_oedORvemz0w.text: Decent Italian food that is definitely overpriced (this seems to be a recurring theme in Vegas). Ordered the octopus and potato appetizer and the trio of pastas to share with a friend. Left us with room for dessert. Would be willing to come here again but wouldn't go out of my way to do so.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio of pastas - also decent
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus and potato appetizer - pretty decent

F_Sapx6DwvuUDFDgP6j1UA.text: This is a nice casual place to eat where you can feel situated in the heart of Venice/Vegas. It's a nice place to order shareable plates as well as entrees. My wife and I ordered a meatball appetizer, carpaccio, and the pizza Cristina, which was our favorite. The meatballs and polenta were a great combo. It was our first time trying carpaccio and we certainly would order it again. The pizza Cristina features prosciutto and arugula, which are two foods we love. Good service and pleasant lively environment. We were able to listen to the live music playing at the Venetian every 15 minutes or so.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza Cristina
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carpaccio with arugula, cheese, and capers
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs with polenta.

9s44KCu9V1lRNnFNAUPswg.text: The food was delicious, i love thair margarita pizza caprese  salad and chicken with spicy souse , everything was great only the waitress too slow, we order black tea and he bring just a hot water, after 5 minutes when water already cold we find him and asked to bring a tea, i been there a couple time and i like a service but this waitress oh my god to slow , and he was talking with other table to long maybe 15 to 20 minutes he just stay with them and talk.

t3m0OdRObXgP_blu2KQZAg.text: Your paying for the location on the Canal at the Venetian Resort and the breathtaking views of St. Mark's Square, the Grand Canal, and gondolas passing below. The food is in no way award winning authentic Italian cuisine. It's basic at most & is extremely expensive. Do not order any sea food here. Maybe that's why it was so bad. I should have just ordered a pizza or something "Italian". See pics. Every dish will cost you an average of $45 bucks & that's without drinks so you do the math.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with grilled vegetables! Average not worthy of a $45 price tag!
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t order Sea food here! Looks good taste bad! Rubbery &amp; not fresh.

LfueLrcoM4ZTogfmf9zdTw.text: If you're in the Venetian, this place is definitely a lovely place to stop.  While my friend and I were there a couple months ago, there was a trio of live musicians playing beautiful Italian music - a flutist, a violinist, and an accordion player, and we had a good view of them while enjoying our food.  Our server was very attentive, and our food was delicious.  They had some interesting vegetarian options, which is an absolute must for me.  If I can make it at home, why go to a restaurant and pay for it?  I had their ravioli, with a special sauce, nuts, and asparagus - very good.  I can't remember what my friend had, but he enjoyed his meal, as well.  For dessert, we decided on the tiramisu, and it was a good choice.  I definitely recommend this place, especially if you're wanting to go on the gondola rides, since this restaurant is just around the corner.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The musicians we enjoyed while eating our dinner.
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a8JQYCY1udTpXiZK3CxJmg.text: This place makes good pasta. But out of all the amazing restaurants in Vegas it definitely isn't the best, especially for the price.  I had the gnocchi bolognese and it was good. The atmosphere is nice and the service is good.  Maybe we should have tried Mario Batali's place next door.

kgwKMJXgXpjiv7eIxxlong.text: I love the Venetian. I am so glad that they are not charging for parking. I came here with my girlfriend to see a show last night (Human Nature Jukebox).  We decided to try this restaurant because of the seven dollar happy hour sign outside the restaurant.      The service was a little bit lacking, but the food was pretty good for the happy hour menu. Our waiter's name is Aldo S., this guy does not smile, very slow in coming to our table, when he finally came to our table he says, "Happy Hour!"  We asked for some lemons for a water, he forgot. about it! It took forever for him to take our orders.  Finally, we got our food and we asked the guy who put the food to our table for some bread, this man was very rude, he said to us that we  have to ask your waiter!! He walked away, as if he didn't give a crap!! This is terrible service, and I blame it on the management for not training these waiters and wait staffs!! We look for our waiter for the longest time, finally, Aldo S. Came to our table. Again, we asked for lemons for our water and some bread! After about eight more minutes, Aldo came back with some sliced lemons and bread!! This waiter is obviously not happy with his job, he doesn't  smile and he acted like he's  Annoyed with us for the things we ask him for.  There are so many restaurants at the Venetian, unfortunately this waiter ruined this Nice restaurant reputation!      Everything was very delicious, but the calzone, was just too salty for me. I would come back here again, but, I hope the management would have retrained the waiters and wait staffs for better services.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks beautiful, but too salty!!
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved this pizza!

TJnLSQ6fjMN5DzgTiVNngg.text: Came here for a quick drink on Sunday night, I was in town for a conference. I had a glass of Moscato (about $10.75) and we also ordered a cheese board.  The cheese board was very tasty, it came with a few different cheeses and breads, along with some sort of fruit (pear?) that was soaked in a different kind of juice, I think. The breads tasted fresh, and we also got olive oil/balsamic vinegar to dip it in.  The bartender was amicable too. I would come back here when in the Venetian and wanting a quick drink or bite to eat.

AWQIBR8-mSai_WNdRHj_wA.text: What sight to see and smell!  Didn't have a chance to stop by and dine here but my observation of this place is a good one.  Crowded and full to the max with lots of people. The food smelled great and everyone here seemed to be having a really great time. As I was making my way to the gondola I was impressed with the service here as well. Lots of moving bodies working together to get orders out and check on tables.  I believe there is a bar area here as well.  I do not think you need a reservation here but I would double check to be on the safe side.  Oh, if you have a google app you should get the translate so that you can make an effort to pronounce the food on the menu. It shows and effort as opposed to pointing!!!! Ahhhh, pointing is just odd!!  #enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What an incredible place!!

nIDGMhGHvBs5vRzyG1SmAw.text: Took very very long,  my Lobster ravioli was cold, the plate was hot, the food was not. Pasta was undercooked, the meat ball was dry and almost felt burnt. The staff looked like they did not want to treat us. Our meal all together was $310 for 6 people and it was not very good.

XxB53fLSvykFczS-jqUZEA.text: We came back here after several years/. Our first trip was so memorable we looked forward to impeccable service and amazing food.  This time our food was average at best and it took 45 min for our food to come. During this wait our server never checked on us or even updated us that the food was coming. Dropping +$100 was a bummer and we are done coming here. We sat down at 7:30 and for a party of 3 we left at 9:15. We were offered free dessert but at that point we wanted out.

yn_5m_GATCQsOK1Fz_XuXw.text: Poor service and Olive Garden quality food for $80.00. That is all.   Well okay, that's not fair...Olive Garden is a little better than this.

4uPUuxn5DD5X6Ga_rEY3qQ.text: The location is good. The food is expensive and not very good. Most of the employees are OK, but "Sheri" the receptionist is absolutely terrible. I'm not revisiting the place as long as "Sheri"  is there...

j71amrtP6lLCyFd55CgB7A.text: I thought this was a great place considering the location and reasonable prices inside the Venetian. The service was great and the food was solid.

ohGSqBDCU7_JZLs54pJoLw.text: I eat here with my family we had a good waitress but the other one next to us was kinda loud the food was decent and if you like people looking at you while you eat then inside or outside is good I would say it's pricey  I would not probably go back here

s3epon6WqyJkP3A9kHmYkA.text: We came here wile on vacation from San Diego and the Venitian is always a joy to visit, then to end the day on a high note, dinner at Canaletto! Is a beautiful restaurant, very elegant, great service and exquisite Venitian style food! We had a great linguine pasta with seafood, the kids had pizza that they loved and the risotto Sant'Erasmo with baby artichokes, shrimp and crab is always my favorite!  You can count on finding the food consistently prepared the way it's supposed to be done, and the service is very attentive!  They make you feel their hospitality, everyone is helpful and smiling, making us feel very welcomed!  Very good value, Thank you to everyone working at Canaletto!

HB_lOyaaaZJExnneK2J4mw.text: The food and drinks (specifically the lemon drop) were perfect, but most importantly our server was absolutely amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8ZSrWvYEAtlcEDcstkRadg.text: Terrible service and mediocre food. The location with the patio entice us to eat there, but the staff is very weird, more suited to an apple bees not a high scale restaurant, glasses with water spots, the waitress spilled water all over our table when pouring the water in our glasses (no apologies), tried to take our drinks before we were done, instructed the other waiter not to use the pizza boxes for our pizza left over (we threw it away because it was all sticking to each other), very disappointing experience!!! The pasta very oily, the pizza crust is too hard, Salmon was ok, dessert nothing special.

AuK-xu3Svf7pDJg06ultAQ.text: Love the location of this restaurant, right in the middle of the canal shops at the Venetian. There are performers just outside the restaurant you can watch. The food was great. We went for happy hour and I got the calzone. It was only 8 dollars during happy hour when its normally close to $20, and it was the same size which was huge. I got the ginger mojito cocktail, which was like a mix between a Moscow mule and a mojito, so good! If you can make it to this place at happy hour its definitely worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginger mojito
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour calzone

2FL2B7YwXsY-lXmt6R0KBA.text: Wow. Absolutely beautiful ambiance. Located in "St. Marks Square" you get the amazing ambiance of the open square, the entertainers, the gorgeous lighting, and the "alfresco" feeling. Next best thing to actually being in Italy.   The bread basket is good. Nothing crazy special, but tasty. My fave was the olive roll. The food was also very tasty and well prepared. The star dishes being the pastas.   Pasta trio (5/5 stars): rigatoni Bolognese, pear and Gorgonzola ravioli, and pesto gnocchi. All the pastas tasted very fresh, light, flavorful, and satisfying. Gnocchi can be hard to get right sometimes, but this one was perfect.   Mushroom risotto (4/5 stars): my husband said this was one of the best risottos he's had. It was a bit too sauce heavy for me, but good overall.   Veal (2/5 stars): my dad got this and hated it. He said it was tasteless and not enough sauce.   Mushroom spaghetti (3.5/5 stars): a simple but still delicious dish. Again, the pastas are where they shine!   Chicken (3.5/5 stars): a bit on the drier side, but great flavor that made up for it. A little bit spicy!  Overall, a nice option in the Grand Canal Shoppes. The food won't blow you away, but it's good, and the ambiance will blow you alway.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta trio
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom risotto

2fLNKqMxukQqUxhS4hPVVA.text: Open late, good food and our service was pleasant too, especially the busser (very personable and attentive- wish he could train all service providers!) The pizza was delicious and also the fish entree, the salad though was very sad.

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OGWsdjTCuJthMOqQRqG46w.text: So we were hoping to have a great dinner on "the square" in the Venetian to celebrate 3 milestone birthdays in our party.   We were a party of 7.  Let me begin by saying the restaurant in gorgeous, and in a great setting on the square, but that's where the positives end.  To begin with, when we wanted to order drinks,  our waiter told us (3) times, "Please give me a few minutes."   Right there we should've gotten up and left.  When we finally got our drink order in, I watched our drinks sit at the service bar for 10  minutes.   I almost walked over to the bar and picked them up myself.    When we finally got the food order in I proceeded to watch our server joke around by the kitchen pick up counter, meanwhile we were all in need of new drinks.  Needless to say, it was a repeat of what I said in the previous paragraph.  When the food came, it was just ok, nothing spectacular.  Being an "off the boat" Italian  family, dinner is always followed by Dessert / Espresso.    But given our waiter's service throughout the meal, we chose to just leave and get the rest at a different place.   It's a shame for the restaurant... (7) desserts and Espresso sure can pad a check.  We just didn't want to give this restaurant any more money, so we got the check and left.  Keep in mind this was the service that we had, I did watch other tables get much better service than we did,   I forget the name of our waiter, but he was an older gentleman who did not wear one of the tan jackets that the other servers were wearing..  For the first time in years, I tipped below 15%.     I can say that we never will come back to this restaurant, we'll try somewhere else on the square.  This restaurant was full, so I'm sure that they don't even care if a bad review is posted.

JdMgOVRX27hdiNBkjgb3Nw.text: I wrote my review under Canaletto Ristorante Veneto  This place isn't worth the money!

9z9jOw-cQ5dlZm0XabjMVw.text: This is one of our favorite places to visit when in Vegas. My husband and love the atmosphere and amazing food. The staff is always super sweet and very helpful. Love getting together with friends. Must visit if you're in Vegas

eRTqRddwURB-ZmsdRQWjqA.text: Let me tell you I've seen a lot of happy hours in my time but most of the time, you see it they try to give you less food for half the money this is not one of those places this is the place where you get a premium mixed drink for 7 Bucks and a large pizza which is the best! here again seven bucks 4-6pm I believe it's Thursday through Sunday but don't quote me look it up! Unbelievable you will be happy you left from here! And you will be full I know I am I couldn't stop eating it! I got the one with spicy sausage inside unbelievable definitely have to try this place during its happy hour especially!   Highly recommended inside the Venetian Hotel!  Peace

3yt_Mikii0tQG0EYw7CPGA.text: service wasnt the best but the food was delicious!!!  italian style pizza and risotto!!!  had a peach champagne mmhmm!!

photos.caption: Photo of Canaletto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

usrBV7_7ruBuz3UXXhlYqQ.text: Amazing restaurant. Makes you feel like you are in the middle of Italy! Service was top notch. A great place to go if you want to eat a nice long meal with a bottle of wine. We split a truffle oil and arugula pizza that was delicious. I got the chicken cannelloni, wow, it is heavy, but great flavor.  My coworker got a risotto dish that was fantastic as well. No complaints about anything!

DTjPbpaWF5MZAJPAKQQcUA.text: I am not a big fan of Italian food but I've had great Italian food before and this wasn't it! My pasta was extremely greasy and food was like warm when it came out! The only good thing was the bread and water. There is nothing special about this restaurant and it is overpriced for the quality of food you receive. You will simply be paying an arm and a leg just because it's located in the Venetian. Not worth it. You will get better food if you decide to cook it yourself.

caUsEgHC95y6mA5TjqfBNw.text: What a wonderful meal! I had linguine with sea/shellfish.  It was delicious.  The drinks were above par as well. The waiter we had was not very attentive otherwise 5 stars.

4nxZl9xF6X_dlhOvRIGV1g.text: We had dinner in piazza San Marco while listening a very nice piano and violin concert, and having tasty Italian food...what more could you wish for.  The polipo con patate was nice and filling. The fried calamari were not that worm but the taste quite Italian...The risotto was delicious. They are very Italian also in the service, polite and friendly. If you are in Vegas don't miss this spot of Italy!!!

k51S_FHdsL8uUCCurUpP-g.text: Canaletto hosted our wedding dinner in Sept. of 2014, and it quite simply exceeded all expectations. We had a room above St. Mark's Square that comfortably fit 60 people, the service was fantastic, the food was outstanding, and the price was extremely reasonable. We brought in our own cake (actually a cupcake tower) so we substituted the dessert for the cake-cutting fee.  We looked all over the strip for a place that would comfortably fit our group without killing our pocket book while delivering a meal that people would remember, and we hit a homerun - we felt extremely lucky, because as everyone knows the strip can be very over-hyped and over-priced.

ip5WW5wopz-jEMt0IKV83g.text: AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE.  Came here for a late dinner around 10pm the last time I was in Las Vegas and while the ambiance was relatively pleasant, I was thoroughly appalled by the overpriced food they were serving and the incredibly slow (non) service.  If you're forced to eat here, definitely sit outside on the patio. People raving about the ambiance like it is was God's gift to men--wait, what? Have you never seen the sky before? It was simply a restaurant with patio seating with views of the artificial sky dome of the Venetian Hotel plaza. If you wanted a nice meal under the "sky", chewing a piece of gum outside on the Strip would be more enjoyable.  Also, descriptions of this place being classy is REALLY pushing some low standards.  Service was nonexistent and glasses were left unfilled for 30+ minutes. They only took our drink orders at the beginning of the meal and never asked again. One should never be left thirsty in Las Vegas.  The food here is on par with a Chili's (ew). We ordered Caprese, Beef Carpaccio, and a charcuterie plate.  Our waiter messed up the order and gave us a Calamari (the calamari wasn't awful). The meats in the charcuterie assortment were sodium-loaded and of very low quality and for the first time in my life, I left unfinished slices of proscuitto on the plate.  I ordered gnocchi, and it was not good--pasta texture was soggy and overcooked, served lukewarm, bolognese sauce tasted like it came out of a can leftover from WWII. Tried some of my friend's pizza...wish I hadn't.  Ordered hazelnut gelato for dessert--too sweet and literally the smallest portion of gelato I have ever received. How did we go from large, crass serving portions to Canaletto's sad attempt at molecular gastronomy dessert plating?  You'd be better off saving your time and money by having a satisfying quick meal at the food court if you're hungry in the Venetian.

TopyayFT-jDrXuSRduPhYQ.text: I'd give this place 3.5. Service : I got my appetizer before I even got a glass of water and bread...The server was in a bad mood before we even got to our table, so it felt like we were annoying her even more by sitting in her section and eating there.  The host - told me to wait, than 30 sec later he is smiling again telling me exact same thing he told me 30 sec ago, and then he says, "oh, wait, didn't I speak to you already". I was like yeah, man, less than a  minute ago! Pull yourself together.  Food: it was good, the salad tasted yummy, warm octopus salad was delicious... My girlfriend ordered an entree - scallops. The scallops were huge, juicy and fresh, but not seasoned at all.  Overall the freshness of food and the quality is good, but the service is letting the place down. I understand they are super busy, but I am not paying money for frustration, I am paying for a pleasant experience, and I hope that management will figure things out.

_C4bE96-722tpR-l_WmZqw.text: My experience was perfect. I ordered a glass of Chianti and Bruschetta. I was please with both.

j5vywomspGH9XUpn30uTLA.text: We got married at the Palazzo 3 years ago and had our dinner reception at  Canaletto. We came back this X-mas for our anniversary and were trying to order some of the items from the wedding during lunch. Apparently the menu was a special menu. So instead we got the pizza Cristina, the mushroom soup, and a 1/2 dozen oysters to start. The oysters were nothing spectacular, husband didn't care much for it. The soup was tasty and the pizza was delicious. I do love the arugula with prosciutto and Parmesan combination. The service was great and our waiter did try with our wedding menu. The one thing I did manage to get from then, a glass of the sgroppino, which was as good as I remembered it. Overall, we'll becoming back for future anniversaries.

pmg0EoNU9eGCs7Q3PBgzyw.text: A must whenever I got to Vegas. Its my favorite. The food is delicious. The ambiance of the square, the people watching, the opera singers from the balconies. It would be a great loss not to come here.

2qu3DqIQLZwF5WoryqQmPQ.text: Probably one of the more decent meals I had while in Vegas, but still quite average by my personal standards.   Nice atmosphere - located right in St Mark's Square.  Friendly guy but extremely slow service! Water being forgotten, can't place dessert order, no refill on olive oil, etc...   Not too many vegetarian choices and limited customizations because apparently the food is pre-prepared in the mornings, not made to order.   Portions were very inconsistent - while some entrees were huge, others were tiny!

lVadOh93ZO0f2cKgmHpeUQ.text: We came here to celebrate my mom's birthday and had a fabulous dinner thanks to Vito, our server, and the talented chefs who made our outstanding meals! We sat "outside" in the piazza and listened to live music, it was all so beautiful and the music along with our server helped to entertain my toddler (bonus stars if possible)! I wish I could remember the names of the dishes we had but they were long and authentically Italian lol! I do know we had a brilliant ravioli dish, a wrapped pasta stuffed with chicken, and an angel hair pasta with tomatoes and basil. Everything was incredibly yummy and cooked perfectly! Vito surprised my mom with a delicious Creme brulee and our evening was complete! Thank you Vito!

RjzvgYld3m7coLz8-pdC_Q.text: Good food.  No complaints about service.  We had a work lunch, asked our server to split the check 3 ways and he happily accommodated.    I had the seafood sampler appetizer and the salad di pere - both were enjoyable.  Reasonable drink prices for Vegas.  Happy hour deals are hard to pass up.  Note:  Vegan options are not great.

AeDIytiftSDmlHL2ss8Gbw.text: Listen to the one stars. This is dog food at best. They have a guy with an italian accent at the front to create fake authenticity and that is where it ends. It is all precooked dogfood. Walk to the back and watch the cooks take everuthing from metal can to heat up. Cold dry meatballs from last week. What a pethatic excuse a restaurant. Kal Can is better.

ciLSNmS0n1tcJ3mKA1WIcw.text: One word---Delicious! We took some family members here while they were visiting from out of state. Each meal looked better than the next. Everyone was perfectly full afterwards.   There was a definite ambiance to the restaurant. And even without reservations, our group was seated immediately inside the restaurant overlooking the Grand Canal. The waitress was great and accommodated nicely to my neice's 'picky' requests, which was greatly appreciated.

dfqF5OHv-ZplOafrEtrwdQ.text: This was my second time coming here, and I actually loved this place once. I wish I can say the same for my second visit. It was just not as good as I remembered it.  I was raving about this place before, and actually have been meaning to come back. Now I wish I didn't come back and just kept that sweet memory.  What we ordered: *CAPESANTE CON RISO DI VENERE (Grilled sea scallops with black Venere rice salad of fennel, radicchio, micro arugula, crispy lemon slices and parsley - $27.59) - Loved the scallops, but the venere rice salad ruined it for me. It was sooo citrusy and sour that it almost kinda starts to burn your lips. The rice was also hard to eat. It was either the rice that was at the bottom of the pan and was over cooked, or the rice wasn't cooked enough. It became difficult for me to enjoy the food. I don't know if that kind of rice was suppose to be like that, but I've eaten plenty of rice in my life, and I don't think it should be like that. I told our server about my rice sitch... and she gladly brought me back better batch of that rice which was much better.  *LINGUINE ALLA BURANELLA (Thin flat pasta with mussels, prawns, scallops and clams seasoned with tomatoes, crushed red pepper, garlic and trebbiano wine - $25.99) - What my bf ordered... I tried it and it was mostly pasta. It didn't have that much flavor, and was pretty bland. The seafood, however, was perfectly cooked, so at least that was good.  I guess this restaurant has a different people cooking the seafood and their carbs? Because the carbs (which makes up most of the dish) is really off while the seafood is on point. This is one of those restaurants that didn't really justify the price of the food. I've had better Italian food for a fraction of their price.  **Their restrooms are upstairs. Why? I don't know. It also doesn't seem like it's being maintained properly because the door for the stall wasn't in good condition. I mean it's not dirty per se, but it's starting to look run-down.

UFlqlQ09e7HgGxxO0CzQaw.text: AMBIANCE: 5 stars I came here for a company anniversary dinner and we were lucky enough to be seated in the private room on the 2nd floor. This room overlooked the balcony and the Venetian lake / bridge / cobble-stoned floor. The restaurant set up was beautiful and extremely classy. Perfect for a date night!  CUSTOMER SERVICE: 5 stars - I felt like a princess! They were like little ninjas, weaving in and out between the diners, cleaning up and serving without any disruption! - They were the most gracious, the most polite, and the most attentive waiters EVER.  - We had a team of around 7 waiters constantly going around, checking up on everyone, refilling water, folding napkins, etc. - They cleaned up every every single course and it was refreshing to not have to flag people down in the middle of your conversations.  FOOD: 4 stars - It was pretty dericious. I apologize to my fellow Yelpers out there for forgetting which course I chose from the menu (our group had a preset course menu), but I know I ordered the salad (which was very well seasoned and very flavorful) and ordered the steak which unfortunately was a little on the dry side (I asked for Medium Rare).  OVERALL:   This is a lovely date area (def. romantic), great for people watching especially if you sit outside (also great for making passerbys jealous of your food), and if you're a stickler for customer service like me.. this is definitely the place to go.

sl4cdPb_Xs0h2wyu5FPdfg.text: Enjoyed dinner here with a friend one night.  Loved the "outdoor" ambiance provided by the Venetian.  I enjoyed a salad and then the rotisserie chicken.  My entree size was huge - I could not finish the entire plate.  The food was good, but I would have been better off with another entree.  Our service was slow, but that was not a problem as we were enjoying our conversation.

TH5UFeIn5rQrn59ueC-IRQ.text: I set up a private room for 20 people after my wedding on the wedding bride right next to Canaletto.  It was a terrible experience!  My wife and I showed up after our families, since we were taking pictures on the grounds, and the moment we showed our families informed us that a live cockroach was found on the dining table.  The server grabbed it with a glass and plate and proceeded as if nothing happened. I then asked to speak to the manger.   We worked out that is discount would be applied to our bill. Sadly, this was not the end of it. We went 35 minutes unattended and the table was broken which kept hitting the bride's father on his legs. Once more I asked to speak to the manager, by this time my wife was extremely sad, upset, and embarrassed.  To top it off the food was sub-par. My steak was not cooked as I order it and my wife's fish was not cleaned properly.  The apple crepe dessert was soggy and thick.    Overall, this was a horrible way to spend our wedding reception.

qlReb1un1pGBH0tkqOYgWA.text: Meh... exactly, meh.  Was super excited to eat here as it is inside the Venetian Canal Shoppes with the gorgeous simulated streets and sky.  There is seating "outside" and inside the restaurant.    Finally decided to give it a try, but I wish I had had something more memorable. Portion sizes are also real small for the high prices!  I'm very picky with food and my boyfriend loved it, so take that into mind as you read my review!  First of all, the ambience is undeniably beautiful and intimate.  You will get bread and olive oil with balsamic, as is customary in Italian restaurants.  Not only will you get sourdough, but also a couple of tiny bread balls- one with rosemary and one with sesame seeds.  I ordered the Risotto with Asparagus, Chicken, and Saffron $20 I don't know what it was but it tasted so darn cheesy! I mean, SUPER CHEESY as though it had been saturated with that Mac n Cheese powder cheese. Boyfriend loved it, but he has no other risotto to compare it too! Also, the pieces of chicken were super small and the asparagus was even split in two to make it seem as if there was more...  Boyfriend ordered the Chicken Cannelloni $18  Consisted of 2 pasta rolls of about 6 inches in length and 6 in full diameter.  They were ALRIGHT, nothing to get excited about.  Again, boyfriend loved them.  For my taste, they were average cannelloni that you could get at any other italian restaurant.  Finally, we chared the Tiramisu $8. Another disappointment for me.  The piece was pretty small and not as layered as other Tiramisu I've had.  Mostly, it was creme and hardly other layers of flavor.  Yes, you guessed it, boyfriend loved it.  Overall, it was an "ok" place. Although my bf loved the food, he didn't like the small portions for the high prices so we WILL NOT BE GOING BACK!

Aec83hn4q0cW81WJrQO1LA.text: Had a great dinner! Calamari was delicious, as well as the Insalata Di Pere. We got ribeye steaks that were amazing and in my humble opinion, was better than some of the steak restaurants, for a fraction of the price!! We had a very engaging waiter who topped off the experience.

Fz7qAAb-8gbrxb5a-QxjOQ.text: Went there around 2:00pm for lunch. It was totally full outdoor (patio) so we just sat inside of the restaurant. Actually it was not bad at all to sit inside because the decor was very elegant and romantic. The service was very great. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful. The menu had a variety of items and you should easy to find what you like.   We had ordered:   Salads: INSALATA DI PERE (Arugula, radicchio, frisee, grilled pears, grapes, Belgian endive, crumbled blue cheese, toasted pecans, pomegranate dressing) - Very FRESH and very good combination of fruits and veggie  INSALATA BALSAMICO (Organic baby lettuce, carrots, balsamic vinaigrette) - Again, very fresh but no special for this salad   Main Dish: CANNELLONI DI POLLO (Large pasta tubes filled with rotisserie chicken, mushrooms, organic spinach, sundried tomatoes and smoked mozzarella; bechamel and tomato sauces) - good portion and great flavor but slightly salty to me  GRIGLIATA DI PESCE CON POLENTA (Grilled Chinook salmon, seabass, prawns and sea scallops with fresh lemon and herb sauce; served with grilled polenta and sauteed vegetables) - All seafood were well cooked and tasty.   The bill was $85 with tip. I thought this was very reasonable for a restaurant in the Venetian........ Overall, a pleasant environment with good food...would definitely recommend to anyone!
